loans.name: Ashirbu

texts.ru: Аширбу, 54 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и 2 дочери. У Аширбу среднее образование, уже 30 лет она занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Аширбу есть 4 коровы, 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход Аширбу составляет в среднем 13,000 сомов (KGS). Аширбу очень трудолюбива и ответственна. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит 8 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Аширбу увеличить ее хозяйство и дать достойное образование детям.
texts.en: Ashirbu is 54 years old, married and has 3 sons and 2 daughters. Ashirbu has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years. Today, Ashirbu's farm contains 4 cows and 40 sheep. Ashirbu's average monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). Ashirbu is very hardworking and responsible. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 8 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will allow Ashirbu to grow her farm and provide a decent education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 42 year old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Najma has requested a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Najma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Alhaji Alhasan

texts.en: Alhaji Alhasan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabuwar Unguwa Village. Alhaji Alhasan joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Alhasan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Alhasan now has the opportunity to increase his  yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 29 years old he is married and his wife sells toys. Jose wants to help his wife by giving her money to buy more toys for her business. Although Jose works as an employee for a construction materials company, he has no money to give to his wife.   That is why he needs your kind help. He is healthy and he is responsible

loans.use: to buy toys to enlarge his wife's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate her land and buy livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is Hassan.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 5 and 3 years all are school going children. In 2001, Hassan established his timber business. He began his business as he used to help his father in running his business after school hours.  He decided to fully involved in the business after his Senior Secondary School Certificate.  He could not afford college fees. 

 He has no one to rely on with determination to make life he choose to follow the footsteps of his father, he has improved is family business and has a large share in the business.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 5,238,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Hassan requires a loan in order to purchase assorted timber. In the future, Hassan plans to improve his social status and complete his education.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase assorted timber.

loans.name: Musa Yohana

texts.en:
Musa Yohana is a Babban Gona farmer from Nabai Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa Yohana no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide good healthcare for his family. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Musa Yohana has ambitious plans to harvest 45 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa Yohana now has the opportunity to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecile has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Cecile requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a Mexican dairy farmer who used to spend an important amount of his income in the monthly purchase of LP gas. He decided to invest in a biodigester in to replace the LP gas with biogas that he produces himself, by transforming his cows' and sheep's manure into renewable energy and organic fertilizer inside the biodigester. 

He will save money while also reducing his carbon footprint, as he will treat his animals' manure, thereby avoiding greenhouse gas emissions and protecting underground water sources. At the same time, his wife will breathe clean air while she cooks with biogas, instead in inhaling the toxic smoke produced by burning wood. By applying the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on his corn field, Emilio will increase its yield in a natural way, improving his farm's productivity and cost-effectiveness.

This loan represents 28% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 20 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a Babban Gona farmer from Nabai Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Elisha no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to move into a better home. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Elisha has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Elisha now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Ahmadu

texts.en:
Ahmadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Ahmadu joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ahmadu will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Ahmadu has set high goals of harvesting 90 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Ahmadu has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 45 years old, married, and had three grown-up children. He is a farmer planting and harvesting rice to sell, while his wife is raising pigs to sell for additional income. Ruben owns and manage three hectares of rice fields. He had been in his farming business for over 20 years now. 

Ruben is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. He hopes to improve his crop production and continue operating a good flow of his business. He hopes to save money for his family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn busies herself in managing her direct-selling business. She deals in products for men, women and children, such as soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and others. Evelyn is able to support her husband with their daily needs and the education of their three children. 

She wants to expand her business, so she has reached out to Paglaum MPC for the funding needed, and applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more inventory to sell. She is happy to earn an income for her family. She hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Lomela

texts.en:
Lomela is a 52-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lomela has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and has been in business for 15 years. Lomela requested a PHP 40,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of school supplies and school uniforms.

In the future, Lomela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies and school uniforms.

loans.name: Rogelin

texts.en:
Rogelin is 45 years old and is married with five children. All of her children attend school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Rogelin runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Rogelin would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Relania

texts.en:
Relania, aged 29, is a married woman residing in Loon, Bohol. She has three young dependents. Her oldest child is ten and the youngest is three.  She earns a living for selling frozen goods like longaniza (sausage), hotdogs and lumpia (consists of a briskly fried pancake filled with bean sprouts and various other vegetables such as string beans and carrots). She has been engaged in that kind of business for three years now.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional supplies of frozen goods, like lumpia and longaniza. With the additional capital, Relania would be able to purchase a variety of frozen goods to sell to the locals in her community. With these, her income will slowly improve and provide her family with healthy meals. 

Relania hopes that with proper handling of her existing business she will become productive and be able to finance the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of frozen goods to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anita has a business selling soft-drinks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Anita has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of soft-drinks to sell.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sandra works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing boat business in the Philippines. Sandra is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena: Es una mujer luchadora, madre soltera de un pequeño de 1 año de edad. Originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Trabaja como maestra de educación primaria. Con el propósito de construir poco a poco su vivienda de tambo y madera, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar un terreno, ya que actualmente habita en casa de familiares en una vivienda de un solo espacio, que es compartida por 5 familiares. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
María Elena is a courageous woman and is the single mother of a one year old infant. She is from the city of Bilwi, a part of Puerto Cabeza, and belongs to the Miskito ethnic group. She works as an elementary school teacher. 

With the goal of building her wooden stilt house, bit by bit, she is requesting her first loan to buy a plot of land. She currently lives with her relatives in a house with only one room, which is shared by five people. She dreams of having a proper home.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elisa is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and is married with two children. Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, eggs, candies, condiments, junk foods, soap and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an E-loading business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional prepaid loads to sell.

Almira successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Almira's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid loads to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 37 years old and is married with five children. With two children in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as E-loads, soap, junk foods, candies, condiments and other groceries. Jenny has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 36 years old and married with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Joan has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Joan requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more items to sell such as bags, pants, school uniforms and other ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as bags, pants, school uniforms and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 years old and is married with three children. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirteen years. Carmelita requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, drinks, breads and other personal care products.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like milk, coffee, canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, drinks, breads and other personal care products.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 20 years old and married, with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joanna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, dried fish, eggs, candies, coffee, canned goods, and other groceries. Joanna requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Joanna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 35 years old and is married with three children who are all in school. Ma. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soap, eggs, shampoo, fabric conditioner, sugar and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarette, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarette, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Villalyn

texts.en:
Villalyn is 37 years old, and is single with eight children.

Villalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Villalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Yessenia Mireya

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Sagrado Corazón se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 10 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en la ciudad.
Doña Yessenia es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos  se dedica  al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, sabanas, edredones, productos Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), actualmente y con la ayuda del crédito anterior también empezó a vender carteras ya que sus clientes siempre le pedían, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 13 años dedicada a esto lo cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar perfume, cremas, bisuterías, sabanas, carteras y todo lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 13 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y su  familia.
texts.en:
The loan group Sagrado Corazón (Sacred Heart) meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited at every season of the year, and for being a city with unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions. 

Señora Yessenia lives is this place. She is 40 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children, ages 11, 10, and 4. The two older ones are in school. Her husband works in a business in the city. 

Doña Yessenia is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own income and with this help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children, sells clothing, shoes, sheets, quilts and Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, jewelry, etc.).  Now, with the help of the previous loan she has also started to sell handbags since her clients have always asked her for them.

Her form of selling is door to door, and she also sells in her house, where her customers come when they need some product. She leaves her products on credit and collects payments every week. She has been in this business for more than 13 years, and she began it with one of the loans that the group received, for which she is thankful. This loan is to buy perfume, creams, jewelry, sheets, handbags and everything that she sells. She has been in the loan group for 13 years, and she likes it because with the first loan she began her business. Her dreams are to give the best to her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, jewelry, sheets, handbags etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old, married and has three children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Arlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nancy is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nancy has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, etc..

Nancy has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion and roll on.

loans.name: Laima

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Laima works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs, a general store, buying and selling fish and meat and food vending. Laima is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Laima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rebcecca

texts.en:
Rebcecca is 47 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Rebcecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebcecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Rebcecca has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, hopia, soap, junk foods, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Rebcecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 43 years old, married and has six children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Julieta has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Julieta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Linda is 48 years old and has two children still in school.

Linda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other materials for her business.

Linda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, junk foods, candies, coffee, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old and has two children. Lucia is married and has one child still in school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and married with two children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Wilma has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, vinegar, soy sauce, junk foods, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Odeyssa

texts.en:
Odeyssa is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Odeyssa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee and etc.

Odeyssa has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Odeyssa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.en:
Teodulo is 55 years old, he is married and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. For a living, Teodulo owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members. This is his primary source of income and he has been doing this for many years. 

Now, he has has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for motor spare parts and repairs to continue his business operations. Teodulo is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Teodulo hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs to continue his business operations.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 43 years old, widowed and has one child to provide for. She is the one who provide for her child so she wants to earn a living to provide for the needs of her child. 

As a single mother she wants the best for her family, so she engaged in a piggery business as a source of income. She aims to increase her income that's why she took a loan to buy feeds for the pigs to result in a good quality of pigs and to have a good sales in the market.

Leizel wants for the future to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her child.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Junelo

texts.en: Junelo is from Liloy in the Philippines and is 26 years old and single. Junelo owns and operates a specialized retail store selling office and school supplies in the local community. He has been doing this for over three years. Junelo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business operations. He has become a full-pledged member of PMPC and has requested a new loan of 49,900 Philippines pesos (PHP), which he will use to buy additional inventory and as working capital. Junelo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 43 years old, married with six children.

Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices and etc.

Ofelia has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ofelia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 56 years old and has six children. Editha is married and has two children who are in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Editha has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, banana, spices, utensil and other materials for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, banana, spices, utensil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a woman and 50 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 56 years old and married with three children.

Rosalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarette, canned goods, home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

Rosalia has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarette, canned goods, home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 47 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 47 years old and has five children. Felicitas is married and has one child in school.

Felicitas is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Felicitas requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felicitas has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felicitas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Ethel

texts.en:
Ma. Ethel is 32 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Ma. Ethel works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Ethel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like toys, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Ma. Ethel has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, toothpaste, candies, junk foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Ethel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like toys, junk foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Prescila is 56 years old.

Prescila has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Prescila requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Prescila has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Prescila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Noris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noris es una mujer de 55 años de edad ella es una mujer campesina madre luchadora y pujante, una persona humilde que valora lo que tiene, junto con su esposo consolidan una familia la cual al complementan 7 hijos.

Noris se dedica a la cría de cerdos, mientras su esposo se dedica al cultivo de yuca entre los dos se codean para sostener su familia y su único deseo es tener los recursos necesarios para vivir tranquilamente ya que en su humilde hogar han pasado maravillosos momentos y ha visto dar a luz a todos sus hijos.

Ella en el momento necesita abastecer sus cocheras pues se acerca una buena temporada que es las feria de flores, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento, con lo que seguirá realizando al profesión que ha desarrollado por tantos años.
texts.en:
Noris is a 55 year old woman.  She is a farmer and a mother, is driven and tenacious, and a humble person who values what she has.  Together with her husband they have a family with 7 children.

Noris raises pigs while her husband grows Cassava and between the two of them they work equally hard to support their family.  Her only desire is to have the necessary resources to live in peace and enjoy her humble home where she has enjoyed wonderful times and which has seen the birth of her children.

At the moment she needs to refill her pig stable as a good season is coming, marked by the Feria de las Flores (flower fair).  For that reason she is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed, with which she can continue in the occupation she has worked at for so many years.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed, with which she will continue in the occupation she has worked at for so many years

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una hermosa joven del campo, una emperadora que tiene un negocio de cría de cerdos, lo fundo pro iniciativa propia buscando recursos para apoyar a sus padres y para su auto sostenimiento quiere estudiar, quiere ser alguien en la vida, sacar su familia adelante, tener carro, moto, casa propia, finca.

Ella debe competir en su vereda con personas que exportar sus cerdos, su esta es consolidarse y no dejarse vencer por ellos, para ello debe invertir en su negocio, ofrecer unas excelentes condiciones en su cochera que cumplas los estándares mínimos de calidad exigidos por las empresas que compran cerdos.

Con el ánimo de volverse una seria competidora en la vereda Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, lechones y las adecuaciones necesarias para cumplir los estándares mínimos de calidad que exigen las empresas.
texts.en:
Lina is a beautiful, enterprising young woman from the countryside who has a business raising pigs.  She founded her business with her own initiative, seeking resources to help her parents and to support herself.  She wants to study, to be someone in life, to help her family move forward, to have a car, a motorbike and her own house and farm.

In her municipality she competes with people who export pigs, she wants to consolidate her business and not be beaten by them.  For this reason she needs to invest in her business, and provide excellent conditions in her pig stable to meet the minimum standards of quality demanded by the businesses that buy pigs.

With the drive to become a serious competitor in the municipality Lina is requesting a loan to buy pigs, piglets and the necessary improvements to comply with the minimum standards of quality that the businesses demand.

loans.use: to buy pigs, piglets and the necessary improvements to comply with the minimum quality standards that businesses demand

loans.name: Subiendo A Lo Alto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUBIENDO A LO ALTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicios de salón de belleza, venta de accesorios de autos, venta de juguetes,venta de edredones y venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adita es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza; da a conocer que en el lugar donde ella vive vio que no había salones de belleza, porque es muy distante de la ciudad así que ella decidió estudiar peinados para abrir su salón de belleza, en la zona donde vive.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tinte para el cabello y crema acondicionador por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente trabajar con estos artículos en su  salón. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las reuniones de pago.

C.F. ALTO LIMA
texts.en:
The loan group "Subiendo a lo alto" will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II. It is composed of eight members and is lead by a board where Adita is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied, among them are: beauty salon services, selling car accessories, selling toys, selling quilts, and selling food. The loan that they will get will benefit the small businesses where Adita is a member. She says that it has been a year since she joined Pro Mujer, getting in through her mother's invitation who is a client of the institution. 
Nowadays, she has a beauty salon. It goes to say that in the place that she lives, she saw that there were no beauty salons because it is very far from the city, so she decided to study hairstyles to open her beauty salon in the area where she lives. The loan that she will now take out is to increase her resources (to buy hair dye and conditioner at wholesale) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz to later work with these items in her salon. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has three children. When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the payment meetings.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and conditioner at wholesale.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a single mother with two children to provide for. She wants to earn a living to meet the needs of her family so she buys and sells clothing as a source of income. She wants to increase her income for her children and so she has taken out a loan to buy more stock. This will enable her to increase her sales.

Nelsie plans to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn makes a good earning by hog raising in Liloy. This is how she supports her husband in raising their family and sending her children to school. 

Jocelyn approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase bags of pig feeds and vitamins. She has high hopes that she will have more savings for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of pig feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Liloy and married. She joined PMPC, in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Wilma wants to expand her resources and engage in a livestock business. Recently, she accessed her fourth loan of an amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products in the local community and to buy native chicken and goats to resell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business and buy native chicken and goats to resell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, condiments, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, vinegar, soy sauce, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, condiments, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sharmella

texts.en:
Sharmella is 34 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Sharmella works very hard to provide for them.

Sharmella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell  like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Sharmella has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Sharmella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell  like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es de la ciudad de Villarrica, lleva una vida humilde y trabajadora apoyado por mi familia en todo momento. Él está estudiando la carrera de Bioquímica clínica, con el cual quiere ser un profesional exitoso.
Jorge pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida por medio de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Villarrica.  He lives a humble and hardworking life, helped by his family every moment.  He is studying for a degree in clinical biochemistry, with which he wants to become a successful professional.

Jorge is requesting a loan to be able to pay the university fees and cover expenses.  He is thankful for the opportunity to be someone in life by dint of his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa has always dreamed of owning and managing her own retail store to support her needs. She is a widow and lives in Liloy, in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory items such as sugar, oil, milk and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and to better supporting her children.

loans.use: to restock her general store

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
Palmira es una persona con ganas de alcanzar los objetivos propuestos que es ser una persona profesional. Su deseo es ser una profesional exitosa y capacitarse cada día más. Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con la cual podrá ayudar a las demás personas, y también a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Palmira is a person who has the desire to achieve her proposed goals, which is to be a professional person. Her desire is to be a successful professional and to train herself more every day. She is studying for a nursing degree, with which she will be able to help people, and also her family. 

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the program fees and, with that, be able to continue with her education as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a dos nietos en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con este beneficio. Isabel desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas en su vivienda, actividad que le ha permitido brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Isabel anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual no logro invertir por necesitar comprar unos medicamentos, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared en su vivienda, que le permita brindar una mayor protección a su vivienda y su familia.
texts.en: Isabel is 63 years old and lives with two grandchildren in a house she owns, so she is very happy to be able to have this benefit. Isabel, for some years, has worked making tortillas in her home, work that allows her to offer a better quality of life to her family. Previously, Isabel asked for a loan which she wasn't able to invest because she needed to purchase some medications, so she is asking again for a loan from FUSAI which will allow her to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and metal to build a wall in her house, which will allow her to offer better protection to her home and family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and metal to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: Anderson is from the community of Badian on Cebu in the Philippines. He is 51 years old and married with two children aged four and eleven. Anderson has been fishing for 35 years and sells fresh fish for a living. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net, sinker and floats. With these tools, he can be more productive at fishing and thus improve his catch and income. Anderson works hard so he can live an abundant life someday.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, sinkers and floats

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is a 54-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosaura has a spice selling business in the Philippines and has requested an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell, such as onions.

Rosaura has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Marsia

texts.es: Marsia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, su mayor aspiración es de ser una excelente profesional al recibirse y poder retribuir a su familia el esfuerzo que hacen por ella para poder salir adelante. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios, ya que con este préstamo que solicita quiere poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en: Marsia is from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying for a degree in commercial engineering. Her greatest aspiration is to be an excellent professional upon graduation and to be able to return to her family the efforts that they are making for her to be able to get ahead. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue with her studies, since with this loan that she is requesting, she wants to pay her program fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia continua poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para continuar con sus estudios, ya que es muy sacrificado, a la vez que estudia también esta trabajando, sigue estudiando la Carrera de derecho, con miras a convertirse en una excelente abogada. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Nathalia continues putting forth her best effort to continue with her education. Since she is very selfless, while she goes to school she is also working. She continues studying in the law program, with an eye on becoming an excellent lawyer. She says that she used her previous loan to be able to pay the program fees.

Today she is asking for another loan to be able to invest it in paying the tuition payments and, with that, be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector esta estudiando para ser licenciado en educación física, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas, lo cual le fue muy útil, el es una persona que esta esforzándose mucho para poder cumplir con su meta de ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo esta haciendo
texts.en:
Hector is studying to get a degree in physical education. He says that he used his previous loan to pay fees, which was very useful. He is a person who is working very hard to be able to achieve his goal, which is to be a good professional who helps others.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the program fees and with that be able to continue his education as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO RENACER” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CD´s, venta de ropa, servicio de taller soldador, venta de comida, venta de condimentos, venta de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizeth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por necesidad hace cinco años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra chamarras y pantalones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Renacer" loan group will begin its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is composed of eight members and is lead by a board where Lizeth is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied. Among them are: selling CD's, selling clothing, welding workshop services, selling food, selling seasonings, and selling jewelry. The loan that they will get will benefit the small businesses where Lizeth is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, from a friend's invitation who is a client of the institution. 

Nowadays she has a business selling clothing. She discloses that she started this business five years ago out of necessity. The loan that she will now take out is to increase resources (to buy jackets and pants at wholesale) which she will get from wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and later she will sell them in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is in a common-law marriage and has one son. When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy jackets and pants at wholesale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agroindustrial con el propósito de convertirse en un buen profesional y con ello poder ayudar a sus padres en el negocio que tienen.
Este año está defendiendo su tesis y con ello podrá tener su título y ser un buen profesional. Su propósito es seguir estudiando para poder superarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación y con ello poder cubrir ese costo alto que tiene para tener su titulo.
texts.en:
Pedro is studying agro-industrial engineering with the goal to become a good professional, and with that, to be able to help his parents in the business they have.

This year, he is defending his thesis, and with this he will be able to have his degree and be a good professional. His goal is to continue studying to be able to improve himself. 

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the expenses of registering his degree, and with this, be able to cover this high cost that he has in order to have his degree.

loans.use: to pay the fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La  Sra. Lourdes es auditora en una empresa dedica al servicio de créditos es soltera,  y por la noche estudia una nueva carrera, la de Derecho,  gracias a su trabajo ella puede estudiar.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia , aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lourdes is an auditor in a business which works in loan services. She is single and at night she is studying a new profession, which is law. Thanks to her work, she is able to study.

She is a very responsible person and is dedicated to her schooling and her family. She aspires to be a good professional and continue studying and serve people. She asks for this loan to be able to pay the program tuition and, with this, be able to continue with her education as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay program fees.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira continua con sus estudios en ciencias de la Educación, con el cual quiere ser una buena profesional que ayude a las demás personas que al igual que ella quieren ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su anterior préstamo de kiva le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar materiales para su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Elvira continues studying education, with which she wants to be a good professional who helps others, and also she wants to be someone in life. She says that her previous Kiva loan was a great help since she could pay the program fees.

Today she is asking for another loan to be able to purchase materials for her program, and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, es estudiante de la carrera Ciencias Contables, desea terminar su carrera para un mejor ingreso, tanto para ella como para su familia, resalta que de aquí en tres años se ve ejerciendo su carrera como profesional , y ayudando a las demás personas, y para poder cumplir con su meta se esfuerza al máximo todos los días.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Zulma, is a student in accounting sciences. She wants to finish her degree to have a better income, for herself and for her family. She projects that in three years she will be working in her career as a professional and helping others, and to be able to meet this goal, she works her hardest every day.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program, and with that be able to continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is 53 years old, married and has two children to provide for. She is a corn farmer and wants to increase her income so that she can provide a good living for her family. Thus, she has decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizer for the corn farm so she can produce a good harvest.

Rodelia wants to save money for the future to sustain the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase university materials.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en: Carlina is 46 years old, married and had three children who attend school. She and her husband have been farmers for over 20 years now. The couple plant and harvest rice to sell. Aside from her farming business, she also raises pigs for added profits. Her revenues go into school fees and bills at home. She is now asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay farm labor costs. These will help improve the crop production and harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cinnamon, achiote, cloves, pepper, cumin, peppercorn, etc. and this way continue improving her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Adjo vit à Adakpamé et vend des produits alimentaires dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des sachets d’eau, des bols de farine de manioc et de blé, Adjo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Adjo is a married woman and has four children. She lives in Adakpame and works selling food products in her area to earn a living. She procures her goods once a month from the local market. 

Adjo is seeking this loan to make orders for sachets of water and manioc and wheal flour, which will provide her the needed earnings to help her husband take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 12 sachets of water, 15 packs of manioc flour and 40 packs of wheat flour

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée et âgée de 38 ans qui habite Adakpamé. Akouavi est mère d’un seul enfant et travaille activement pour son épanouissement. Pour trouver son revenu, Akouavi vend des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile dans le quartier et gagne son bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Akouavi s’approvisionne huit fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz. Akouavi souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 38 years old, married, and lives in Adakpame. She is the mother of one child, and she works hard for his/her development. 

For work, Akouavi sells sacs of rice and drums of oil in the area and earns [enough] thanks to this activity. She procures her goods eight times a month and is seeking this loan to order sacs of rice. 

Akouavi wishes to increase her profit margin and to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of rice

loans.name: Jiovane

texts.en:
Jiovane is a father of three children at the age of 37. For seven years, he has been managing his own rice farm. He engaged in a rice production business to earn a living. As the father of the family, he wants the best for his family so he decided to buy seedlings for the rice farm to start planting the rice field. 

Jiovane's plan for the future is to save money from his business to improve his house.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for his rice farm.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Adjovi est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à Adakpamé Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Adjovi se promène dans son quartier pour faire le commerce général. Adjovi réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des boissons et des sucettes, Adjovi demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
At 34 years old, Adjovi is a married woman with two children in Adakpame. To support [her children's] development, Adjovi travels her area and sells general goods. She is able to earn a living thanks to this work. 

She procures her goods five times a month at a market. 

Adjovi is seeking this loan to buy drinks and candy so that she can earn a profit that will help to better take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 18 bottles of drinks and 20 packs of candy

loans.name: Kouadjowa

texts.fr: A 44 ans, Kouadjowa est une femme mariée et vit avec un enfant à Adakpamé. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Kouadjowa  achète son stock auprès de ses fournisseurs trois fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Kouadjowa désire ce crédit pour commander des tomates, des épices et des bidons d’huile afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
At 44 years old, Kouadjowa is a married woman and lives with her one child in Adakpame. Well aware of her living situation, she sells general food products in her area in order to earn enough to cover the everyday expenses.

Kouadjowa buys her stock from suppliers three times a month and is able to make enough profits. She wishes to have this loan to make an order of tomatoes, spices, and oil so that she can earn enough to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy four trays of tomatoes, three sacs of spices, and two drums of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wire, pins, eye pins, nylon, elastic thread, leather, chamois cloth, colored gems, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, pants, t shirts, and more items to allow her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Dieubéni

texts.fr: Dieubéni, 34 ans, et est marié. Il a un fils. Il vend des chaussures depuis 8 ans dans la ville de Croix-des-Bouquets. Cette activité lui permet de générer les revenus nécessaires pour prendre soin de sa famille. Grâce au crédit, il ne fait plus de rupture de stock. Le crédit lui permet d’augmenter et de renouveler régulièrement ses stocks.
texts.en:
Dieubéni is 34 years old and married and has one son. He has been selling shoes for eight years in the town of Croix-des-Bouquets. This work allows him to make the necessary earnings to take care of his family.

Thanks to this loan, he no longer has gaps in his stock. This loan allows him to increase and renew his stock on a regular basis.

loans.use: to buy new shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cheese, rice, flour, butter, and sugar

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is aged 50, married and they're blessed with three children. 

She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 8,000 a month. 

Because she has inadequate capital to use on her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jucelyn

texts.en:
Jucelyn, 31, is a mother of five children. She wants to earn her living and help her husband who is a tricycle delivery driver. As a mother, she wants the best for her family. Therefore, she engaged in charcoal vending as her business. To have more sales, she decided to borrow a loan to buy more charcoal stocks to sell to generate more income.

Jucelyn plans to invest in other businesses with her business income.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 43 years old and married with five children. All of her children are attending school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing 38,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenny has been farming sugarcane for 13 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a tricycle passenger businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура, 44 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. На протяжении 20 лет она занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть лошадь и 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход Манзуры на сегодняшний день доходит до 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Манзура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и обработку почвы для выращивания лука.  Доходы от кредита Манзура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Manzura is 44 and married with four children. She has a specialist secondary education and has been working in animal husbandry for 20 years. She currently has one horse and three sheep on her farm with a monthly income of up to 16,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Manzura has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase livestock and to prepare the soil so she can grow onions. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to prepare her land so she can grow onions and to buy some livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new tools for the production of cakes

loans.name: Laurius

texts.fr: Laurius est dans le commerce de chaussures usagées depuis dix ans. Âgé de 45 ans, marié, il a trois enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son activité a beaucoup progressé depuis qu’il lie partenariat avec Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal. A travers ce partenariat, il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs crédits. Ces crédits l’aide à augmenter son stock pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Laurius has worked selling used shoes for ten years. He is 45 years old, married, and has three children, who are all in school. 

His business has developed a lot since he became partners with Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal. From this partnership, he has already benefited from several loans. These loans help him to increase his stock and better respond to his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy used shoes

loans.name: Jérôme S.

texts.fr: Jérôme, 41 ans, est marié et père de quatre enfants. Il est revendeur d’appareils électroniques et électriques tels que radios, téléviseurs, mégaphones, rasoirs électriques, etc.  Il fait cette activité depuis tantôt dix ans. Grâce aux revenus qu’il en tire, il arrive à nourrir sa famille, payer l’écolage des enfants et faire un peu d’épargne. Il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs crédits qui ont beaucoup contribué à développé son activité. Il veut garder le cap de progrès de son commerce, il sollicite un nouveau crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Jérôme is 41 years old, married, and a father of four children. He works selling electronics and electrical equipment such as radios, TVs, megaphones, electric razors, etc. He has been in this business for almost ten years. 

Thanks to the earnings from this work, he is able to feed his family, pay his children's school fees, and put a little away in savings.

Jérôme has already benefited from several loans which have greatly contributed to his business's growth. He wants to keep up this development and is seeking a new loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy flashlights and electric razors

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en: Anacita, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients like sugar and glutinous (sticky) rice for snack vending.This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients like sugar and glutinous rice for snack vending

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has always dreamed of buying another lot for her farm land to support her two children. She used her loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Annise

texts.fr: Annise, 52 ans, mariée, est mère de deux enfants. Ses enfants sont régulièrement scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle fait la vente de produits alimentaires. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à payer l’écolage de ses enfants, les nourrir et faire un peu d’épargne. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. Avec ce crédit, elle va doubler son stock de riz.
texts.en:
Annise is 52 years old, married, and a mother of two children. Her children go to school regularly. 

To support her family's needs, Annise sells food products. Thanks to this work, she is able to feed her children and pay their school fees, and put a little away in savings.

She needs a micro-loan to increase her stock. With this loan, she is going to double her stock of rice.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 60 years old and married. Her husband is a construction worker.

To help her husband earn a living she has been engaged in a sari-sari store for 15 years. 

She wants to increase her income and improve their living, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more stock for sell to increase inventory and generate more income.

Lydia plans for the future to renovate their house from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia engages in tailoring  and accepts services like dressmaking, dress adjustment and many others. She is a married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 14 and the youngest is three. 

Virginia is asking for a loan to purchase materials such as thread, cloth and an electric sewing machine. These tools are very important to improve the services she has to cater. With the availability of materials, Virginia will now be able to cater to various customer's request. Thus, this could result in improved income and enable her to pay her obligations.

Virginia is determined to expand her business to be able to support the schooling of her children and be able to secure other sources of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, cloth and an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used for the maintenance of her videoke/karaoke machine. Through her earnings she is able to meet their daily living expenses. 

Aside from her entertainment business, she also has a welding shop where her husband is the welder. She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan that she will use to pay for materials like iron and plain sheet needed for her welding shop. She has been in this kind of business for almost 20 years and established a good reputation for her efficient service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and a good return on her investment for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and medical needs. 

Virginia dreams of having a bigger welding shop. She prays that God will bless her family with good health and they will be able to save for their old age. 

Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials like iron and plain sheet  needed for her welding shop.

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en:
Jonan is 32 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living he is engaged in a sari-sari store business with the help of his wife, also in their business. As head of the family, he wants to give his family a good life so he decided to borrow a loan to purchase more stock to sell and be able to have more sales to generate more income.


Jonan's plan for the future is to expand his business with a variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a 28-year-old married woman and provides for one child. She is engaged in a rice production business to help her husband make a living, and her husband is also a factory worker. 

Cresilda wants the best for her family, so she wants to increase her income to give a better life for her family. So she decided to avail a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm to have a good harvest and have more sales of rice that will result in a greater income.

Cresilda wants to buy a new vehicle from her business income for the delivery of her stock in the market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, cliente se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de güisquil y hortalizas, también trabaja de hacer viajes en su pick up, con lo que obtiene de sus dos trabajos es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mauricio is 32 years old. He lives in his own house with her life companion and their son. He works in agriculture growing guisquil (chayote squash) and vegetables. He also works taking trips driving his pickup truck, thus he generates incoe from both of these jobs to support the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, plague controllers, herbicides, etc. to continue with his crops and get better earnings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, plague controllers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Ricardo Alfredo
