texts.es: Ricardo vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el es empleado de una empresa privada y gracias a lo que obtiene en su trabajo es como logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejora su casa construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de hierro, arena, ladrillo, cemento, pago de mano de obra entre otras cosas y asi el y su familia pueden vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Ricardo lives in his own home with his wife and son. He is an employee at a private business and thanks to what he earns at his job, he is able to pay for the household expenses. He wants to improve his home by building a room in the area shown in the photograph, but since he doesn't have enough capital to do it, he is asking for a loan to buy iron, sand, bricks, and cement, as well as to pay for labor, among other things. This way, he and his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy iron, sand, bricks, and cement, as well as to pay for labor.

loans.name: Glenda Abigail

texts.es: Glenda de 23 años vive con sus padres en vivienda propia sintiéndose muy feliz de poder brindarles su apoyo en la vejez. Ella es hija única para sus padres y desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y el cuido personal para hombres y mujeres ella sale a vender sus productos por ganancia es buena y con ello logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Glenda solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas para cuerpo, cremas para peinar el cabello, spray, gel para el cabello y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Glenda is 23 years old. She lives with her parents in their own house. She is very happy to help them in their old age. She is theironly child and for the last 2 years she has been selling beauty products and personal care for men and women. She goes out to sell her products, her earnings are good and with this she supports her home daily. Glenda is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy body creams, hair styling creams, sprays, hair gel and this way increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy body creams, hair styling creams, sprays, hair gel, and this way increase her earnings.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a 44-year-old male, married, having five children and living in Kasese, Uganda. Semu used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. 

Semu is a food vender who also owns a retail shop where he sells general merchandise to get income to provide for his family needs. He has been in that business for 15 years, and also does brick laying to get additional income. 

He is a hard-working man with a dream of educating his children and expanding his business, although he is faced with a challenge of competition and bad weather. 

Semu wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 60 years old from the community of Badian, Cebu. 

For forty years, Anecita has been dependent on the income that she gets from the buying and selling of mats. She also weaves mats for additional income. 

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy pandan leaves for weaving. She also plans to open a sari-sari (general) store business. With this, she would like to use some of the loan to buy canned goods and other grocery items for her sari-sari store. 

Anecita hopes to sustain her business since this is her only livelihood. Her income takes care of food for her family, electricity, water, and savings.

loans.use: to buy pandan leaves for weaving as well as canned goods and other grocery items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emilio Douglas

texts.es: EMILIO DOUGLAS: Es un hombre amable, trabajador de 66 años de edad, originario de la Ciudad Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Está casado, tiene 3 hijos: 2 mayores de edad e independiente y un adolescente de 12 años que cursa su sexto grado. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la pesca artesanal. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por Pana Pana y a las ganancias percibidas de su negocio le han permitido establecer su centro de acopio de mariscos y pescados. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar las condiciones de su acopio. El sueña con ser un comerciante exitoso.
texts.en:
Emilio Douglas, 66, is a friendly, hardworking man from Ciudad Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  He belongs to the Miskita ethnic group.  He's married and has three children: two independent adults and a 12-year-old who's in sixth grade.  His wife is a homemaker.

For 10 years he has earned a living in traditional fishing so he can have his own source of income to cover the household expenses and his son's education.  Thanks to previous loans from Pana Pana and profits from his business, he was able to set up a collection and distribution center for shellfish and fish.  He's requesting a loan to improve the conditions in his center.

He dreams of being a successful merchant.

loans.use: to improve conditions in his collection and distribution center

loans.name: Cerline

texts.fr: Cerline a 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d’un petit distributeur d’eau potable et vend aussi des lessives. Cette activité lui permet de gagner des revenus pour faire vivre sa famille. Elle arrive même à faire un peu d’économie. Mais, elle souhaite améliorer sa condition financière et offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle a recours au microcrédit.
texts.en:
Cerline is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, who go to school regularly. 

Cerline owns a small business where she distributes potable water and also sells detergent. This business allows her to earn [enough] to take care of her family. She is even able to save a little.

However, she wishes to improve her financial situation and provide her family with better living conditions. 

To avoid gaps in her stock, she is seeking a  micro-loan.

loans.use: to buy bottles

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es: William de 25 años vive con junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años.  William se dedica a prestar sus servicios  como motorista en una empresa que está cerca de su localidad con gran esfuerzo y buen desempeño. William desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que el agua se filtra en época de invierno, y se mojan los enceres de su hogar, Es por eso que él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: William is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, aged 5 and 2, in a house they have owned for several years. William works as a driver for a business close to his town. He works very hard and with a good performance. William wants to change the roof on his house, because water leaks in during the winter and the furnishings get wet. That is why he is asking for  loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on his house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on his house.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is a 30-year-old divorced woman who started a year ago working as a cashier in a company to cover her needs and expenses. Her divorce didn't stop her from dreaming of a better future, so she returned to the university seeking a certificate that will guarantee her life. 

Rena is a clever and ambitious lady who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees.
Rena hopes to finish her studies and open her own business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 49, is married to an overseas Filipino worker and they're blessed with five children. 

She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost a year and and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. 

Because she has insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase beverages, chips, fish sauce, cooking oil, breads, coffee, sugar, and canned goods to sell. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, chips, fish sauce, cooking oil, breads, coffee, sugar, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Baylon

texts.en:
Baylon has a coconut farm in Labo, Aloran. He finds pleasure in doing his farming activities and also earning for his family. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, he sought financial help to purchase a variety of fruit-bearing plants that he can grow on his farm, as well as to pay for dwarf coconut and banana seedlings. In the future, Baylon wishes to buy a rice land to cultivate to provide sufficiently for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit-bearing plants that he can grow on his farm, as well as to pay for dwarf coconut and banana seedlings.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old, married and has one child. 

To help her husband and earn a living she is engaged in a sari-sari store business. 

She wants to improve her living and increase her income, so she decided to avail a loan to buy more stocks and have more sales to generate more income.

Victoria's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita, aged 40, is a mother of six children.   She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living and with the help of her husband, as a farmer, is providing for their family. Mercidita wants a better life for the family so she decided to access a loan to buy more goods to sell so that she can have more sales and be able to generate more income.


Mercidita's plan for the future is to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Profetisa

texts.en:
Profetisa learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and the financial assistance that it provides to start-ups. She has tried her luck in running a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Profetisa has now borrowed another amount to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. Profetisa is looking out for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Al Jr.

texts.en:
Al Jr. is engaged in running a grocery store. He has been operating his business for a year and so far, it has been doing good. Al Jr. is 23 years old, he's single and lives with his parents in Oroquieta. 

He joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and expand his resources. Al Jr.  is a new member of PMPC. Recently, he requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of his existing business. He wants to buy more inventory for his store to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store to increase stock.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. 

PMPC came to Juanita's rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now she availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  

Juanita perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old, a resident of Kabaseke, Kyotera in Rakai district. He is married with 3 children. Only two attend school. 

He deals in a business of electronic appliances which he started in 2007. He also earns a salary since he is a technician doing power connections and solar panel installation.

Stephen works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day and started this business with the aim of improving on his daily income.

Stephen wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more stock so as to meet the needs of his customers. Stephen mostly sells his items to rural and urban people. However his challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business and competition.

Stephen is a hard-working man and is determined.

loans.use: To buy electronic appliances and solar panels to sell.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Madre de 5 hijos, una persona tolerante, laboriosa, amable Así es Bernardina una adorable señora de ya 50 años de edad que desde tempranas horas de la madrugada sale a trabajar en su negocio de venta de alimentos, vende fiambres, almuerzos, morcilla, desayunos, todo realizado a fogón de leña.

Inicio su negocio en el año 2013 con la ilusión de ganar capital para reformar su hogar, construirlo en material (concreto), pero conforme ha pasado el tiempo ha visto que al primera necesidad está en mejorar su local y luego de que se vea lindo y atraiga mayor cantidad de clientes iniciar con las reformar de su hogar que es la finalidad de su restaurante.

Bernardina quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar mesas, manteles, implementos de cocina, alimentos, y uniformes.
texts.en: Bernardina is the mother of 5 children, hard working, and kind. She is an adorable 50 year old woman, who since early morning goes out to work in her business selling food. She sells cold meats, lunches, blood sausage, breakfasts, everything cooked on a wood burning stove. She started her job in 2013 with the idea of earning capital to remodel her house. She wanted to build it in cement, but as time went by she realized that her priority is to improve her business premises and once it looks nice and it attracts more clients, she can start the remodeling in her house which is the main purpose of her restaurant. Bernardina is asking for a loan to buy tables, tablecloths, kitchen utensils, food products, and uniforms.

loans.use: To buy tables, tablecloths, kitchen utensils, food products and uniforms.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un hombre maduro, trabajador, honesto y responsable que desde el año 1985 lleva ejerciendo la profesión de electricista como independiente con la única consigna de mantener a su familia y darle estudios a sus 3 hijos, hoy año 2015 puede estar satisfecho y decir labor cumplida pues gracias a este maravilloso hombre en su hogar nunca ha faltado alimento y sus hijos estudian.

Hoy Santiago tiene otro sueño ya cumplió uno y quiere en el momento comprar una vivienda y trabajara como lo sabe hacer fuertemente por comprarla.

Santiago se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra y modernización de la herramienta de mano que la que tenía actualmente ya cumplió un ciclo de vida bastante largo y necesita la actualización con urgencia.
texts.en:
Santiago is a mature, hardworking, honest and responsible man. Since 1985, he has been working independently in the profession of electrician. His only goal has been to support his family and give an education to his 3 children. Today, in 2015, he can be satisfied and say his work is done, because thanks to this marvelous man, there has never been a lack of food in his home and his children are in school.   

Today Santiago has another dream. He already achieved one, and now he wants to buy a house and he will work hard to buy it, as he knows how to.  

Santiago is asking for a loan to buy and update his hand tools. The ones he has now have ended their very long useful life and he urgently needs to update them.

loans.use: to buy and update his hand tools.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina , 39 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Rubina  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 45000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and soy to feed her dairy cow

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a married man from Badian, Cebu. He has three children who are still dependents. His wife stays at home to look after their children.

Juan drives his motorcycle for passengers. This business of transporting passengers is common in remote places and villages. The motorcycle is called habal-habal. 

Juan is asking a loan to buy a spare tire and pay for vulcanizing (a process for converting natural rubber or related polymers into more durable materials).

For two years, Juan has earned only PHP 2,400 per month. With a loan, he hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire and pay for vulcanizing.

loans.name: Anjelicah

texts.en: Anjelicah is a married woman and  has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of beauty products

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 68 years old and widowed. To survive and be able to provide for herself, she engaged in a rickshaw transport business as a source of living. Her income is through renting her rickshaw to somebody and receiving a rent income from it.

She wants to improve her living; that's why she decided to borrow a loan to purchase spare parts for her bicycle repair and be able to continue to cater to passengers.

Caridad’s plan for the future is to buy a new rickshaw for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her bicycle repair.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina wants to fulfill her dreams by having her children complete a degree through venturing into a sari-sari store business. Angelina has big dreams to help her family and that is the reason why she borrowed the amount of PHP 14,900 from PMPC to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce for her business. She is now  repaying what she owes to Paglaum.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Seregio

texts.en:
Seregio is single and lives in Oroquieta-Pines. He has worked as a driver for the past six years. His business involves hiring out his motorcycle unit and providing transport for the public. Seregio does this work to support both his needs and also those of his parents. 

Seregio has asked for a loan to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motorcycle unit. He would like to own another motorcycle unit to increase his income and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motorcycle unit

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various kinds of dried fish to sell. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Felisa would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of dried fish to sell by the kilo. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and to pay for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Felisa aims to grow her fish retailing business. She wants her children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase several kilos of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is a mechanic and for many years he worked in this field. Now he is a farmer and with his big family, he lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. Martik’s wife is unemployed. They have two sons both of them are married and with their families, they live with their parents. 

Martik has a big farm and a lot of work on it; he takes care of his farm goats, lambs, calves, horses, sheep and chickens. His farm product is mainly the meat that he sells by order to city butchers. He also cultivates vegetables on his land such as potato, tomato, cucumber, greens, carrot and garlic. All these goods he sells locally and also a great part of this goes for his big family use. 

Martik this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams wants to use for the purchase of a cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase of a cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Bibiana Marcela

texts.es:
Bibiana es una mujer fuerte, emprendedora y comprometida con su familia que para colaborar con los gastos del hogar inicio con un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, todo para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ella tiene una pareja con quien tiene un hijo mejor de edad.

Bibiana ha tenido buena demanda para alquilar las lavadoras y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para aumentar su capacidad de cobertura por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar tres lavadoras que significaran un aumento del 100% de sus ingresos si logra tener alquiladas sus 6 lavadoras.
texts.en:
Bibiana is a strong woman, enterprising, and committed to help her family with household expenses. She started a washing machine rental business, primarily to improve the living conditions of her family. She has a partner and together they have a young son.

Bibiana has had good demand for renting out the washing machines. She wants to take this opportunity to increase her coverage capacity so she is requesting a loan to purchase three washing machines. This amounts to a 100% increase in her income if she is able to have 6 washing machines total.

loans.use: to buy three washing machines which amounts to a 100% increase in her income.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
Marisol es una mujer de 37 años de edad, madre de dos hijos una de 15 y otro de 13, tiene un reto en su vida, uno es pagar una maravillosa fiesta de 15 años de su hija algo memorable, comprar vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos. Trabaja en un negocio de confección directa donde ha generado dos empleos, su empresa está en crecimiento y necesita ese apoyo financiero para afianzar los pasos que ha dado en el momento.

Marisol ya tiene recorrido y se siente preparada para sacar su propia línea de ropa y está buscando un apoyo para finalizar ese paso y es un aliento financiero con lo que comprara una maquina cortadora y una maquina recubridora, si la apoyas podrás no solo mejorar la empresa de Marisol si no darle la oportunidad a una persona sin empleo de emplearse como cortador de tela.
texts.en: Marysol is a 37 year old woman.  She is the mother of two children ages 15 and 13. She has a challenge in her life, one is to pay for a wonderful 15 year old party for her daughter to make it a memorable event for her, to buy a house, and to pay her children education. She works sewing directly for clients, which has helped her generate two positions. Her business is growing and she needs financial support to implement the steps she has taken so far. Marysol has experience, and now she feels prepared to launch her own line of clothing so she is looking for support to achieve this step. That is financial encouragement to buy a cutting machine and a recovering machine. If you support her you will not only improve Marisol's business,  but you will alsol give an opportunity to an unemployed person to work as a fabric cutter.

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine and a recovering machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, oil, sugar, cookies, drinks, and other basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en:
Daviti, who is a 36 year old married man, lives in Kutaisi city with his wife and 3 children. The family's only source of income is his wife's salary 200 GEL, who works as a nurse. The income is so insignificant for a five-member family, that they can't satisfy even basic needs. In spite of his high education, Daviti was unable to start any stable job. According to family's needs, he would get any source of income and make his bit to the children's welfare. 

Daviti requested a loan among local credit providers and was rejected several times, as the creditors didn't find enough family-income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Daviti requested a loan from Credo to start up a business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Daviti will purchase a second-hand car and start trading with scrap-iron. He will get the only source of income for himself and will help to cover family-costs. 
Daviti and his family members rely on the good will of lenders and will be very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start trading with scrap-iron

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 39, is a resident of Kayijja, Kyotera in the Rakai district. He is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. He has a farming business which he started in 2005 where he grows coffee and tomatoes. In addition, for a second source of income, he is a technical builder. 

Peter is such a hard-working man and is determined. He works seven days a week and 12 hours per day. He started this business with the aim of improving his daily income and being able to look after his family. Peter’s clients are hotels and home consumers. 

However, Peter's challenges are the lack of enough capital to expand his business, competition and climatic conditions. He would like to borrow UGX 500,000 to buy organic manure for his tomato garden.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his tomato garden

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a resident of Talibon, Bohol.  She is married with five children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is less than a year old. Her husband is a farmer. Gina operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic commodities such as biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and toiletries.  

Gina is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, chips, etc. to sell.  These stocks would help to enhance her store's inventory so she would be able to attract more customers. This would help Gina to improve her daily earnings and to be able to balance her finances. She would then be able to continue to provide her children with good food and a better home in which to live.

Gina is determined to operate her sari-sari (variety) store business so it becomes successful and is able to finance her children's schooling for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Talic, Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old and a widow. Marilyn has owned and operated a retail store selling assorted goods in the local community for over 15 years. She earns a good income, enabling her to provide for her family's needs. 

Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is  31 years old, married, and they have one child. As the head of the family, he needs to earn a living, so he engaged in a rice production business with the help of his wife. 

Elvis wants to give his family a good life and he aims to increase his income. Therefore, he decided to avail a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice farm to produce good quality rice leading to a good harvest and creating a bigger income.

Elvis plans to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Evelia Lorita

texts.en:
Evelia Lorita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelia Lorita is 60 years old.

Evelia Lorita has a food processing business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Evelia Lorita has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Criselda is 45 years old now.

Criselda has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Criselda requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell like pants, etc.

Criselda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medical drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Raza

texts.fr:
Raza est un homme de 73 ans. Il est marié et a élevé 11 enfants avec sa femme dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe sur les hauts plateaux malgaches. Tous ses enfants sont mariés et indépendants sauf un de ses fils qui vit encore au sein du foyer et l’aide dans son travail. Sa femme est agricultrice, lui est boucher. Malgré son âge avancé, il garde encore toute son énergie et exerce son activité principalement au grand marché de la ville.
Il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 2 ans. Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte renouveler progressivement son stock de viande en achetant 160 kg de bœuf et 200 kg de porc. 
Les bénéfices de son activité lui ont permis notamment d’améliorer le quotidien du foyer et le couple a fait dernièrement l’acquisition d’une télévision couleur. Son dynamisme, son courage et son expérience (20 ans dans ce domaine) lui ont permis d’ouvrir 3 autres petits points de vente dans la ville. Il espère parvenir à étendre encore son activité et ainsi avoir de nouveaux lieux de vente.
texts.en:
Raza is 73 years old, married, and has raised 11 children with his wife in the urban area of Antsirabe on the Malagasy highlands. All of his children are married and independent except one of his sons, who still lives with him and helps with his work. Raza is a butcher, and his wife is a farmer. 

Despite his old age, Raza still has all his energy and works primarily in the town's grand market. He has been a partner with Vahatra for two years now. 

With this new loan, he plans to progressively renew his stock of meat by buying 160 kilograms of beef and 200 kilograms of pork. 

Earnings from this work have allowed him to improve his household's everyday life, and most recently him and his wife have acquired a color television.

His dynamism, courage, and experience (20 years in this area) has allowed him to open three other points of sale in the town. He hopes to further expand his business and set up new points of sale.

loans.use: to buy 160 kilograms of Zebu beef and 200 kilograms of pork

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco: Es un hombre luchador y alegre de 37 años de edad, originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, de la etnia miskita, soltero con un hijo de 5 años de edad que estudia su pre-escolar. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal y con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 15 años vende  ropa usada en el corredor de su vivienda de su casa de tambo y madera. Gracias a los prestamos anteriores otorgados por Pana le han permitió construirle a su mamá su vivienda. Solicita un préstamo para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta juvenil. El sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Francisco is a hard working and joyful man. He is 37 years old, from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas municipality, he belongs to the miskita ethnic group. He is single with a 5 year old son who is studying in preschool. Due to the lack of formal employment and with the purpose of supporting his son and help with the household expenses, he has been working for the past 15 years selling used clothing in the alley next to his house made of cane and wood. Thanks to previous loans offered by Pana, he has been able to build a house for his mother. He is asking for a loan to go to Managua and buy a lot of used, mixed, young people's clothing. He dreams of having his own successful business.

loans.use: To buy in Managua a lot of used, mixed, young people's clothing

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is female, 31 years of age, and divorced with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Juliet operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for three years. She started the business in order to look after her children as a single mother. 

She has a dream of expanding her business, educating her children, and building a permanent home for them. Price fluctuations, inadequate capital and competition are her major challenges. 

Juliet will use the loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, curry powder and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, curry powder and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in melons, strawberries, watermelon, jocotes, nances, cashew fruit, etc. to be able to make more and meet the demand for her product.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is grateful is that she was previously granted a loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings, she has been able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. The income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and to cover the education costs for her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Leonora hopes to expand her General Store. She prays that God will always bless her with a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha lives in Solana with her family. She is 39 years old, married and had three children. Editha and her spouse plant and harvest rice to sell.

Editha also raises hogs and offers rice milling services for additional income. She uses her profits for school expenses, household bills, and daily meals. She wanted to improve their crop production in the rice farming business. She had insufficient funds and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use for farming. 

In the future, Editha hopes to continue improving their income and keep providing for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use for farming

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in a rickshaw transport business to earn a living with the help of her husband. She is the driver of their own rickshaw. She aspires to a greater income, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy spare parts to repair her bicycle, so that she can continue to cater to her passengers.

In the future, Flordeliza plans to buy a new bicycle to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for bicycle repair.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rag-making business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed to make her rags. Her round palm sized rags are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning kitchen counters and cabinets. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her as a good return on her investment will surely help cover their daily sustenance.

Delia hopes to grow her rag-making business and prays for a happy and victorious family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rag-sewing business.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadette is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including food vending.

Bernadette dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Salvacion is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucila is 44 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lucila has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucila has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Adjoa est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à Adakpamé Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Adjoa se promène dans son quartier pour faire le commerce général. Adjoa réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des paquets de bougie, de piles et des insecticides, Adjoa demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
At 42 years old, Adjoa is married and lives with her two children in Adakpame. To help with [her children's] development, Adjoa travels her area and sells general goods. She is able to earn enough thanks to this work.

She procures her goods five times a month from a market. Adjoa is seeking this loan to buy packs of candles, batteries, and insecticide so that she can earn a profit that will help to better cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 packs of candles, 10 packs of batteries, and 4 packs of insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the items in her food store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-moving drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date products for her beauty salon and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to supply milk.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, aged 56, is married to a farmer, and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 15,000 a month.

Her net income from her business was spent on the medical needs of her husband and the needs of her farm. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, noodles, frozen foods, and beverages to sell.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, noodles, frozen foods, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is 36 years old, married and has three children. She is engaged in a piggery business. 

As a mother, she wants the best for her family so she aims to improve their living and increase her income. She borrowed a loan to buy feed for the piglets so they will grow to be good quality pigs and generate good income.

Emie plans to save money out from her business income to prepare for the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the piglets.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Herminia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies needed to raise her pigs. Herminia has been raising pigs for twenty years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kevin Patrick

texts.en: Kevin Patrick is a very hardworking single father of two children, one of whom attends school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into photography in order to earn income to support his family. He also has a motorcycle transport business for supplementary income. He hopes to expand and develop his business into new areas. Kevin Patrick is requesting credit to buy a new camera for taking photos.

loans.use: to buy a new camera for taking photos

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 34 years old and single. Lorna works very hard to provide for her needs.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods which she sells at retail prices. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from the store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and to education her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Susan dreams of having a bigger general store someday. She aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and married with two children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Lolita has been in this business for 31 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en: Ana Marie is 29 years old, married, and has one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Marie has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. Ana Marie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en: Analy is a married woman, a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analy is 47 years old and has four children who are in school. Analy has a business making furniture and fixtures in the Philippines. Analy applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has applied for another loan to continue building her business. Analy has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business of making furniture and fixtures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Karina Alba

texts.es: Karina Alba: Es una mujer sonriente, luchadora de 36 años de edad, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Está casada. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingreso y aportar con los gastos del hogar. Ha establecido una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de minifalda (Concreto y madera). Recuerda con gran alegría que empezó vendiendo agua helada, gaseosas y hielo. Solicita préstamo para diversificar sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos, con el préstamo comprara: granos básicos, chivería, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Karina Alba, 36, is a smiling and persevering married woman from the city of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.  She belongs to the Miskita ethnic group.  

She set up a small grocery store on the porch of her home made of concrete and wood so she could have her own source of income and help with the household expenses.  She very happily remembers selling cold water, soda, and ice when she started out.

She's requesting a loan to diversify her products and increase her income.  With the loan she's going to buy basic grains, Chivería products, soda, and other products.

She dreams of having a new clothing store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, Chivería products, soda, and other products

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Anitha, who is in her late 30's, is married with four children who are still at school.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years.  She works from 8 am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Anitha’s 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to renovate her salon.  She painted the shop, bought a dryer and salon products.  She has successfully paid back all her loans.  She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, bought a cupboard for storing chips and covered household expenses.   She will use this loan to buy up to date salon equipment to meet her customers’ requirements and demand.  She dreams of starting a chip selling business.

Anitha will share this loan with her loan group, Torees, which has two members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase up to date salon equipment to meet her customers’ requirements  and demand.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old, married and has five children to provide for. To earn a living, she engages in a sari-sari (variety) store business for providing their family needs with the help of her husband, who is a chainsaw operator. 

She wants to give her children a better living so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more stock to sell to increase her store inventory and be able to generate more income.

Lucia's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen has been selling secondhand clothes for three years, from which she has managed to earn a living. Moreen is twenty-five years old and married with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Moreen is faced with a challenge of market competition due to customers' changes in tastes and preferences. However, she has high hopes of growing her business. With this loan, Moreen is going to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgé de 46 ans, Essi est une femme très entreprenante et active dans la gestion de ses besoins. Avec quatre enfants à charge, Essi habite à Adakpame pour vendre des poissons fumés en parcourant son quartier. Ce commerce lui apporte son bénéfice et Essi s’approvisionne dix fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des cartons de poissons, Essi demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande et réaliser assez de profit pour répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Essi, 46 years old and married, is a very enterprising woman who is active in supporting herself. With four children in her care, she lives in Adakpame to sell smoked fish by going door to door in her district. This business brings in a profit. She gets her supplies ten times a month at the market. To purchase boxes of fish, Essi is asking for this loan to finance her special order and to make enough profit to respond well to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of fish

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 60 años de edad, muy trabajadora, carismática, servicial, honrada y respetuosa que guiada por la necesidad monto un negocio de tienda abarrotes, trabaja durante 12 horas diarias, su negocio crece y está muy feliz porqué se siente útil, genera ingresos y en su hogar se ve muy reflejado su apoyo.

Olga quiere solicitar un préstamo para darle a su negocio un plus extra y es la venta de productos congelados, por lo que quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un congelador, surtido de carnes frías y pollo,
texts.en:
Olga, 60, is a very hardworking, charismatic, obliging, honorable, and respectful woman who started a grocery store business out of necessity.  She works 12 hours a day.  Her business is growing and she's very happy because she feels useful.  She earns an income and her help is very noticeable in her household.

Olga wants to request a loan to give her business a little more by selling frozen products.  She's going to buy a freezer and a supply of cold cuts and chicken.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a supply of cold cuts and chicken

loans.name: Edo

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Edo est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Edo vit à Adamavo et vend des mèches, des tissages et des produits alimentaires dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Edo s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des mèches et des tissages, Edo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Edo, 34 years old, is a married mother of two. To operate her business, she lives in Adamavo and sells hair extensions, weaves, and grocery items in her district, thus to earn her income. She gets her supplies five times a month at the local market. To put in an order for hair extensions and weaves, Edo is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and get the profit necessary for helping out her husband to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase 40 hair extensions and 16 weaves

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans qui vit dans le quartier de Baguida pour entreprendre son activité. Mère de  quatre enfants, Kayi vend des céréales et des œufs dans le quartier pour subvenir aux divers besoins. Kayi s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché. Kayi demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine et des plateaux d’œufs afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Kayi désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Kayi is a married woman, 35 years old, who lives in the Baguida district to operate her business. The mother of four children, she sells grains and eggs in her neighborhood to cover her diverse needs. She gets her supplies six times a month at the market. Kayi is asking for this loan to put in an order for tubs of flour and trays of eggs in order to have good sales and more profit. Her wish is to make a profit for supporting her husband to cover family expenses and for allowing a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 30 tubs of flour and 17 trays of eggs

loans.name: Angie Marcela

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 19 años de edad, soltera sin hijos que monto un negocio para ayudar a su familia y poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, proviene de una familia pobre pero trabajadora.

Angie tiene una venta de abarrotes, vende panela,  frijoles, sal, arroz, antojos, dulces, entre otros productos, empezó hace poco por lo que su surtido es aún muy básico.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para diversificar su oferta basada en una necesidad que hay en el barrio y es la falta de papelería y heladería, por lo que con el préstamo comprara surtido de papelería, una fotocopiadora y surtido de helados.
texts.en:
Angie is a 19 year old single young woman without children, who set up a business to support her family and to pay for her university studies. She comes from a poor, but hard working family.

Angie has a small grocery store selling raw cane sugar, beans, salt, rice, snacks, candies and other products. She began recently so she does not yet have a broad range.

She wishes to request a loan to diversify her stock based on the needs of the locals, and lack of stationary store or ice cream store. This means that with the loan she will buy a selection of stationary, a photocopier and a selection of ice creams.

loans.use: to buy a selection of stationary, a photocopier and a selection of ice creams.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven increíble, con una energía y una menta ganadora a sus 20 años de edad monto su negocio de droguería solo con sus ahorros, tiene 3 empleados y un futuro enorme por delante.

Ella vende aparte de drogas medicadas, pañales y productos de aseo personal, no él tiene miedo a la inversión y ahora quiere solicitar un préstamo para dar un alto enorme en publicad y es que con el dinero pagara un pauta publicitaria en radio para que su negocio sea reconocido y se quede en la mente de las personas, con el capital restante comprara surtido de pañales en las diferentes etapas.
texts.en: Natalia is an incredible youth with energy and a mentality of winning. At 29 years of age she has opened her pharmacy business through her savings. She has 3 employees and an enormous future ahead of her. Besides medicine she sells diapers and personal use products. She is not afraid of investing and she now wants to request a loan  to give an enormous publicity boost and with the money pay for a publicity campaign on radio so that her business is recognized and is branded onto people's minds. With the remaining money she will buy diapers of different sizes.

loans.use: to pay for a publicity campaign.

loans.name: Bonyokwa Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Skondiwe, who is in her mid-forties, is married with four children who are still at school. She has been running several projects: a nursery school, selling tap water and drinking water, and selling sarongs and fabrics for three years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Skondiwe's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loan to increase her business and also opened a salon, and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to renovate her nursery school, to buy sarongs and fabrics, to fill her tank with water to sell as tap water and increase stock of drinking water. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Skondiwe will share this loan with her loan group Bonyokwa Kisiwani, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate her nursery school, to buy sarongs and fabrics, to fill her tank with water to sell as tap water, and to increase stock of drinking water.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulia es una humilde mujer que con su negocio de cría de aves brinda un gran aporte a su hogar y es que ella se encarga de comprar el alimento, su esposo paga la cuenta y entre los dos se codean para mantener una familia que la terminan de conformar 3 hijos, ellos son muy humildes, una casa rustica, pero son felices, son honesto, no necesitan robar, todo lo ganan con sudor y esfuerzo.

Eulia para mejorar su negocio, ser más competitiva, vender en mayores cantidad, dar mejores precios, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento de engorde
texts.en:
Eulia is a modest woman who greatly supports her household with her business raising birds. She buys the food, her spouse pays the bills, and between them they do enough to provide for their family of three children. They are very modest, and live in a rustic house, but they are happy. They are also honest: they do not need to steal, they earn everything with effort and hard work.

Eulia wishes to improve her business, to be more competitive, sell in larger quantities and offer better prices, so she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and weight gaining feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and weight gaining feed.

loans.name: Sabina Milena

texts.es:
Ella es Sabina una mujer que está a punto de dar un gran paso, por ello en la foto se ve con una enorme sonrisa y la razón es que se encuentra realizando un préstamo para iniciar una labor como comerciante, piensa distribuir ropa, lociones, accesorios, calzado, en pueblos, a familiares y amigos, una decisión que fue tomado en base a la necesidad y las ganas de emplearse en alguna labor. 

Sabina quiere que sus hijos estudien, tiene tres menores de edad, les quiere brindar una mejor alimentación, una mejor calidad de vida, apóyala y ayuda a esta mujer a iniciar su primer negocio,
texts.en:
This is Sabina, a woman who is about to take a big step. For that reason, in the picture she has an enormous smile. The reason is that she finds herself getting a loan to start working as a businesswoman. She plans to distribute clothes, lotions, accessories, and footwear in towns, to relatives, and to friends. This decision was made due to necessity and a desire to employ herself in a line of work.

Sabina wants her children to study. She has three children who are minors. She wants to provide them with a better diet and a better quality of life. Support her and help this woman to start her first business.

loans.use: to start her business marketing women’s and men’s clothing.

loans.name: Ivonne Julieth

texts.es:
Ivonne es una joven de 18 años, una persona muy importante para su hogar, ella por amor a su familia, pro agradecimiento hacia ellos inicio a trabajar para apoyarlos en momentos difíciles como los que ahora atraviesan, ella es una joven que quiere estudiar, salir adelante y darle a su familia lujos y nunca verlos pasar por situaciones como la que ahora pasan.

Ivonne vende productos de revista de catálogo, como lo son lociones, accesorios, dulces, productos de aseo persona, ropa, pijamas, para ella es más rentable comprar directamente en la revista y vender los productos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en los productos más vendidos como las lociones, abrigos, y accesorios, tratando de ganas un poco más de utilidad que servirá mucho en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ivonne is an 18 year old youth. She is a very important person in her household. Out of love for her family, through her gratitude towards them she started to work to support them in difficult moments like what they are going through now. She is a young person who would like to study, get ahead and provide her family with luxury and never see them in situations like they are facing now.

Ivonne sells products from catalogs such as lotions, accessories, candies, personal use products, clothing, pajamas. For her it is more profitable to buy directly from the catalog and sell the products. So she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the products that sell the most like lotion, coats and accessories trying to gain a bit more profit which will be very useful for her household.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of lotions, coats and accessories.

loans.name: Leidys Yurani

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer casada, fruto de su matrimonio nacieron dos hermosas princesas que tienen 7 y 1 año de edad, ella es una persona muy hábil, muy pulida, se dedica a fabricar excelentes piezas artesanales en lana, como bolsos, gorros, abrigos, siendo está su actividad principal y la que le genera los ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo para el mantenimiento de su hogar. 


Leidy teje cada prenda alimentando su sueño de comprar una vivienda  propia   y ese motivo es lo que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo quizás no para comprar casa porque es muy apresurado pero si para mejorar su negocio comprando lana para cocer y fabricar una mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Leidy is a married woman. From her marriage, two beautiful princesses of ages 7 and 1 were born. She is a very skilled and polished person. She makes a living by making excellent artisanal wool pieces such as bags, hats, and coats. This is her primary occupation and what generates the income that she uses to help her husband maintain their home.

Leidy weaves each garment, fueling her dream of buying her own home. This motivation is what brings her to request a loan – maybe not to buy a house, because that would be very hasty, but to improve her business by buying wool to sew and make a greater quantity of products.

loans.use: to buy wool to make her handicrafts.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: Jorge es una persona madura, responsable, inquieta, de esos que no puede estarse quieto y tiene que producir, actualmente no cuenta con un empleo, no logra encontrar y tiene un hogar junto con su pareja que necesita alimentarse, pagar cuentas, por ello busca un alternativa y el emprendimiento es una muy buena opción  y quiere tener un negocios de cría de cerdos pero no cuenta con el capital por ello solicita un préstamo para empezar su vida como independiente, con el dinero construirá las cocheras, comprara cerda de cría y lechones.
texts.en: Jorge is a mature, responsible and active person, one of those people who can't stay still and has to be productive. Currently he has no employment and he can't find any. Together with his partner he has a house and has to pay for food and pay the bills. So he is looking for an alternative and a business is a very good option. He wants to have a pig raising business but he does not have the capital for it so he is requesting a loan to start his life as an independent owner. He will build enclosures for the pigs and buy breeding sows and piglets.

loans.use: to start a business raising pigs.

loans.name: Pichbopha

texts.en:
Pichbopha is a 20-year-old single freshman from  Battambang Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in International Relations at a university in the city.  Her father is a teacher, and her mother earns more incomes from selling clothes at a market in their home province. 

Due to the fact that Pichbopha is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her dreams, she wants to run her own business, and she also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees in International Relations from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 20 años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto y cambando el techo pero no tiene suficiente capital por esa razon solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de cemento, arena, polines, laminas y demas materiales para tener una vivienda digan para su familia.
texts.en:
Eliseo, 58 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has made a living from cultivating basic grains for 20 years. 

He wants to improve his home by constructing a room and changing the roof, but he does not have enough capital. For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL for the purchase of cement, sand, beams, sheet metal, and other materials to have a dignified home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, beams, sheet metal, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Avelina is 48 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Avelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Avelina has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 25 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fidela is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Fidela has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Fidela requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like underwear, etc..

Fidela has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Fidela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like underwear, etc.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a resident of Hoima, Uganda. He owns a piggery unit alongside crop production, mainly cassava, to supplement his income. He has hopes of growing and expanding his business on a large scale as he strives hard to be a model farmer.

However, high costs of feed for the pigs alongside limited space hinder the achievement of his desires. He will use the loan facility to buy more feed for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy more feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Akouvi est une femme mariée qui habite à Attiégou. Pour exercer une activité, Akouvi vend des charbons de bois et trouve son gain favorable. Akouvi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Akouvi nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
texts.en:
37-year-old Akouvi is a married woman who lives in Attiegou. She sells charcoal as a business activity, which gives her favorable profits, and stocks up once a month at the market.

To buy bags of charcoal, Akouvi is requesting this loan so she can complete the purchase and achieve more gains for her household's development.

loans.use: buy 33 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ruby Esther

texts.es:
Ruby una hermosa persona, trabajadora, humilde, sencilla, que labora 12 horas diarias en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, su tienda es lo único que tiene para generar ingresos que le permitan pagar sus cuentas, ella vende víveres, abarrotes, algunos productos de aseo personal y aseo doméstico, vive bien, gracias a su larga jornada laboral puede vender lo necesario para tener una estabilidad económica. 

Un negocio de tienda de abarrotes debe estar siempre surtido y la experiencia se lo ha enseñado a Ruby quien quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con abarrotes y granos que son los productos de mayor consumos entre la comunidad ya que diariamente llevan de estos productos y el compromiso de Ruby como propietaria es que siempre que pidan un producto en su tienda tenga existencias disponibles.
texts.en:
Ruby is a beautiful person, hard-working, humble and simple who works 12 hours per day in her grocery store business. Her store is the only way she has to generate income which allows her to pay her bills. She sells food, groceries and some personal use and domestic cleaning products.

She lives well. Thanks to her long working day she can sell enough to have economic stability. A grocery store business always needs to be stocked and experience has taught this to Ruby. She wants to request a loan to stock her business with groceries and grains which are the products that are bought the most amongst the community that daily purchases these products. Ruby's compromise as owner is to always have the product in demand available in her store.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries, grains and foods.

loans.name: Punhan

texts.en:
Punhan is 28 years old, married, and he has a son. Punhan lives in Agdas region with his family. He's been a farmer his whole life, with crops and cattle. He inherited this profession from his parents, so he gained much experience just by being born into it.

He has a small portion of land where he grows onions, carrots, and other vegetables. He sows and harvests twice a year and usually gets a good harvest.

Now he is going to grow other kinds of vegetables and offer them to local people, but his situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes this a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs.

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise. This is going to be his first loan. Please support him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Jazmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La felicidad que resalta en la cara de Jazmina al hablar sobre su trabajo es más que evidente. Ella cuenta los avances que ha tenido durante sus cinco años comerciante de productos plásticos y como dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Esta emprendedora había solicitado un préstamo anteriormente, al cual hace énfasis para agradecer a todas las personas que le ayudaron en ese préstamo, puesto que con él pudo comprar distintos productos plásticos. Los resultados fueron tan positivos, que ahora está sonriente y trabadora mujer desea solicitar un préstamo nuevo. 
Jazmina solicita un préstamo para comprar vasos, baldes, platos, picheles y granos básicos para su pulpería que está en etapa de desarrollo. Con esto no solo podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de producto, sino también podrá invertir en esa pulpería que con tanto esfuerzo ha llevado a cabo. A sus 39 años siente que está comenzando y que va por excelente camino, gracias a su dedicación y al apoyo de su familia. Al cancelar este préstamo los sueños de está emprendedora no terminan, pues considera comprar un vehículo para trabajar en la industria de taxis.
texts.en:
The happiness that stands out in Jazmina’s face when she talks about her job is more than evident. She tells of the progress she has made during her five years marketing plastic products and as the owner of a small grocery store. This entrepreneur had requested a loan before, which she emphasizes in order to thank all the people who helped her with that loan, since it allowed her to buy different plastic products. The results were so positive that now this smiling and hardworking woman wants to request a new loan. 

Jazmina is requesting a loan to buy glasses, buckets, plates, mugs, and staple grains for her grocery store, which is in a stage of development. With this, not only will she be able to offer a greater variety of products, but she will also be able to invest in the grocery store that she has accomplished through so much effort. At 39 years old, she feels that she is starting and that she is on an excellent path, thanks to her dedication and to her family’s support. After paying off this loan, this entrepreneur’s dreams do not end; she is thinking about buying a vehicle to work in the taxi industry.

loans.use: to buy glasses, buckets, plates, mugs, and staple grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and maize seeds for improved farming activity, so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Ahouefa

texts.fr: Ahoefa est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Attiégou pour entreprendre son activité. Mère de  quatre enfants, Ahoefa vend des céréales dans le quartier pour subvenir aux divers besoins. Ahoefa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Ahoefa demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine et du maïs afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Ahoefa désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ahoefa is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in the neighborhood of Attiegou where she runs her business. Mother of four children, Ahoefa sells cereals in the neighborhood to meet her various needs, and stocks up once a month at the market.

Ahoefa is requesting this loan so she can order bowls of flour and maize, sell well and make more profit. Ahoefa wants to generate income to support her husband with family expenses and ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: buy one bag of maize and 20 bowls of millet

loans.name: Adarlina

texts.en:
Adarlina loves to grow plants, specifically flowering plants. She had different flowering plants in their house until she realized she could make it a source of income. Adarlina decided to make it a business.

Presently, Adarlina grows a variety of flowering plants to sell. She sells plants at an affordable price so that she gains more customers, and more sales as well. While managing her growing plants, Adarlina is also engaged in a direct-selling business.
