Adarlina wants to grow her plants faster and produce more flowers to inspire others. In this connection, Adarlina is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy foliar fertilizers to apply. She will also use the loan to purchase products for her direct-selling business.

Adarlina hopes to have enough income to sustain their needs.

loans.use: to buy foliar fertilizers to apply to her plants.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 36 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Amelita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable farm.

Amelita has been farming vegetable for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Ma. Flordeluna

texts.en:
Ma. Flordeluna is 49 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Ma. Flordeluna works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Flordeluna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Ma. Flordeluna has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Flordeluna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is aged 39, a single mothers of 3 children of ages ranging from 1 to 18 years living in Hoima Uganda. She owns a boutique mainly selling material clothes for men and women plus children's wear. In order to supplement her incomes she deals in buying and selling of maize and beans in Hoima Uganda. She hopes to grow and expand her business into new markets. She will use the loan facility to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and expand her market

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is 44 years old,married and he has a 4 children. The eldest has a job, two are in school, and the youngest stays at home. He is independent, careful, responsible, and hard-working. He works as a taxi driver, work that he's been doing for the past  10  years. However, his salary from this business is not enough to cover his family's needs. 

His dream is to see the construction of his house completed. It is for these reasons that Mansur  is applying for a loan 1000 AZN for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house for the health and well-being of his family. Please support him.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne wax cloth and embroidered fabrics

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Don Saturnino vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y también a la crianza de ganado, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Saturnino lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children. He cultivates corn for a living as well as raising cattle. Thanks to this work, which he has done for 20 years, he has been able to get ahead with his family. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. to be able to continue with his crops and thus have a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with seven children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the raising pigs for 1 year and also earns an income from general store.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he has two daughters and a son; all of them are school-aged. Hambardzum always has been engaged in farming and he is already master in this field. In his farm he has cows, calves, bills, pigs and chickens. With the help of his wife Hambardzum sells milk, cheese, meat and eggs to their neighbors and regular customers. 

This peasant family has a lot of needs and with the enlargement of their farm many financial needs could be lightened for this family. Still Hambardzum has lack of fodder for his farm cattle and he asks this loan for the purchase of enough fodder for his all farm cattle. Hambardzum and his family beforehand are greatly thankful for Kiva and Nor Horizon support.

loans.use: for the purchase of enough fodder for all his farm cattle, to be able to support his family

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlie is 37 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Merlie has a photo framing and lamination business in the Philippines. Merlie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Merlie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her photo framing and lamination business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber for sale and to expand his business and also support the family

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a married man. He is aged 40 years old with two children. He lives in a semi-urban setting with his family. His children are 18 and 14 years old, respectively, and they both attend schools.

He runs a pub in a trading center that he has been operating for seven years. He works seven days a week, and each day, he works for 18 hours. He supplements his income with a salary he earns from building. He started this business with the aim of increasing the family income.

He has acquired this loan facility in order to restock his business since sales are going to increase during the coffee harvest season. His customers are local residents, and his greatest dream is to build rentals in the nearby trading center. His biggest challenges are lack of enough capital and poor payments by his customers. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying drinks to sell

loans.name: Gemima Alicia

texts.es: Germima de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero no teniendo suficiente capital, esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y si poder vivir mas comodos y seguros con su familia
texts.en: Gemima is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by making and selling tortillas. She wants to improve her home by replacing the roof. Not having sufficient capital to do this, she is requesting a loan from Integral to buy metal sheets and beams, and to pay for labor. This will let her live more comfortably and securely with her family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and beams, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is a single mother with two children. She's the one who provides for her children. To earn a living and provide for her children's needs, she engaged in a sari-sari (small grocery) store as a source of income. She wants to improve her income, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell to increase her store inventory and be able to generate more income.

Norelyn's plan for the future is to expand her business through her business income.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm in hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Khristel Jane

texts.en:
Khristel Jane is 20 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Khristel Jane has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Khristel Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

Khristel Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, Khristel Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan has vocational education and a specialty of economist, but all his life he is also busy with farming. Vardan is married and he has a son, who now greatly helps him in their farm works. In his farm Vardan has cows, calves, pigs and piglets. His farm’s meat selling is developed and surely profitable. Vardan’s wife sells their farm milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and curd to their number of regular customers. 

Vardan would like to develop pig breeding in his farm, but still he has not enough money for that. Now he has another request and he relies greatly on Kiva support so he could buy enough fodder for his farm cattle.   He sends Kiva lenders his thanks.

loans.use: to buy enough fodder for his farm cattle and also start pig breeding

loans.name: Santigie S.

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Santigie S.  He is married, and has 4 children aged 18, 14, 12, and 9 years, all are school going children. In 2003, Santigie S established his construction items - roofing nail, Evostic, paints and brushes, spanners etc.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Santigie S has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans.  He now requires a new loan in order to buy cartons of nails, staples, roofing nails, lockers etc. 

In the future, Santigie S plans to continue to provide quality education for his children and rent a shop. The previous loan helped him greatly in the business and the education of his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of nails, staples, Evostick, paints, roofing nails, lockers etc to expand his business further

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 17, 15, 11, 9 y 7 años y medio, junto a su esposo se esmeran por sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su zona de vivienda desde hace 14 años, con lo cual se ha hecho de buena clientela y por su amabilidad y experiencia es muy recomendada por sus vecinos como una mujer responsable y trabajadora. María desea seguir construyendo su vivienda que ya esta iniciada la construccion, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillos para la terminacion de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que de esa manera le podra dar mas comodidad y mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her five children, 17, 15, 11, 9 and 7-and-a-half years old. Together with her husband, she has taken great pains to provide for her children so that they will be respectable people.

She sells fruit and vegetables for a living in the area where she lives. Over the past 14 years, she has built a good clientele thanks to her friendliness and experience. She is well recommended by her neighbours as a responsible and hardworking woman.

María wishes to continue the construction of her home, which she has already begun. She has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to finish her house as soon as possible. This way, she will be able to give her family a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: invest in: cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to finish her house.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un prestamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Flor Maria es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:   
Me llamo flor María  tengo 24 años vivo en Santiago de los caballeros nací y crecí en Santo Domingo, tengo 3 hermanas, no tengo hijos, mi papá no trabaja mi mamá trabaja en una finca.
Estudio la carrera de medicina en la Universidad Utesa, elegí esta carrera ya que sentí la necesidad de estudiar la ciencia y poder ser útil para las personas, me siento con la vocación de servir y ayudar y considero que estos ingredientes son necesario para el que estudia medicina, de las materias que me han dado me gustan: La química,  biología, la psicología entre otras, en fin todas me gustan.           
Necesito el préstamo porque los recursos no son lo suficiente para continuar no puedo pagar la universidad necesito el apoyo de Kiva  para continuar sin este no podría terminar la carrera.
Mis metas son ser una gran doctora con especialidad en  urología, sostener a mis padres y seguir siendo ejemplo de mi hermana menor, un lugar para este sueño está aquí. Necesito de ustedes
texts.en:
Flor María is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan to be able to cover her educational costs. This is her story:

My name is Flor María. I am 24 years old. I live in Santiago de los Caballeros. I was born and raised in Santo Domingo. I have 3 sisters. I do not have children. My father does not work. My mother works on a farm.

I am studying medicine in the Utesa University. I chose this career since I felt the necessity to study science and to be useful to people. A vocation that serves and helps agrees with me, and I consider these ingredients as necessary for one who is studying medicine. Of the courses that I have taken, I like: chemistry, biology, and psychology, among others. In the end, I like all of them.

I need the loan because my resources are not enough to continue. I cannot pay the university. I need Kiva’s support to continue. Without it, I will not be able to finish my studies.

My goals are to be a great doctor who specializes in urology, to support my parents, and to continue being an example to my younger sister. This is the place for this dream. I need help from you.

loans.use: to cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon manages his computer shop business. He provides computer rentals and other services. Marlon has been three years in the business and his income serve a fully provision for his family daily needs. Marlon’s wife is a teacher. They are blessed with one child whom they use their income for. 

Marlon wish to save more of his earnings for his child studies. Someday his child will enter college and he wants to respond immediately to his child needs. Therefore, Marlon is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy ink, papers, and other needs to his computer shop. He will do his very best to make his business progressive and gainful.

loans.use: to buy ink, papers, and other needs for sale in his computer shop.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is from the town of Badian, Cebu. She is 32 years old and married with two sons, ages eight and nine. To support her children, she sells pancakes for a living. This business started a year ago.

Leonora is asking for additional capital through a loan from CEVI to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, margarine and eggs. Leonora believed that a loan will make a difference to her profitability. Her income will keep her children in school and pay for food for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, margarine and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for her farm and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Badian, Cebu. She is married with one adult son. Her husband is an electrician. While he works, Teresita is busy with her business cooking snacks called buchi.

Buchi is a rice cake made from sweet rice flour that is molded into shape with a sweet bean paste filling and sprinkled with sugar. Teresita earned PHP 12,000 per month. She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil, flour and mongo beans.

Her profit helps pay for the household expenses like food, water and electricity. In the future, she plans to make other snack food to increase revenue.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and mongo beans

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina works hard to support herself. She is single and has a buying and selling fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

Quirina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Quirina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is a 48-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Vergie has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. Vergie requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion and other products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Vergie has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Vergie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica a prestar su servicio doméstico y a la crianza y venta de pollos y ganado y de esa manera saca adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios. Anteriormente ella obtuvo un crédito para la levantar las paredes de un dormitorio y para seguir mejorando su vivienda desea un nuevo préstamo para techar un cuarto y elaborar una galera por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito a FUSAI e invertir en: laminas, cuartones, hierro y polines para terminar las mejoras en su vivienda y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, ages 12 and 10. She works as a housekeeper and also raises and sells chickens. That is the way she is helping her children continue their education.

Previously she obtained a loan for building walls of a bedroom, and to continue improving her home she wants a new loan so that she can roof a room and build a covered area. So she's requesting a new loan from FUSAI to purchase sheet metal roofing, beams, rebar and lumber for completing improvements to her home, and in this way provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal roofing, rebar and lumber for completing improvements to her home.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 57 years old now.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Zenaida has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 64 years old and married. Teodora works very hard to provide for her them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, condiments, sugar, and other groceries.

Teodora has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Teodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, condiments, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florencia is 58 years old now.

Florencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Florencia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Lamrana.  She is widowed, and has a 12 years old school going child. In 2010, Lamrana established her provisions business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. 

Lamrana has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of assorted provisions - milk, biscuits, sweets, cornflakes, mayonnaise etc. In the future, Lamrana plans to reinvest and improve her business. She was able to buy building materials from the profits she raised during the last loan.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of assorted provisions - milk, biscuits, sweets, cereals, etc.for sale in her shop to support her child

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine used the previous loan to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell. She is a farmer and at the same time sells produce. She faces challenges of price changes and competition. However, she is looking forward to expanding her business to new areas and has applied for a loan to buy more maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a married man, aged 38 years with six children who are 17, 15, 13,11,9 and 7years respectively. He lives in rural area with his family and all his children are still attending schools. He deals in agricultural produce like selling of coffee, beans, ground nuts and maize. He works five days a week and each day he works for 8 hours.
He started his business in 2003 with the aim of earning a living since he had no alternative source of income.
 
He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy more stock of beans, ground nuts and corn.
His clients are traders from surrounding towns and his dream is to own a produce store in a nearby trading centre but his biggest challenges are lack of enough capital.
He describes himself as a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy stocks of corn, beans and ground nuts for sale in order to support his family

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi Village. Usman joined Babban Gona to increase his income. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usman will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.  

This season, Usman has grand plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Usman now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Melody Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Roselyne, 26 years old, married and a mother of three children who are all in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices vegetable farming, e.g., kale, and also buys and sells charcoal. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy more charcoal and, hence, add stock to her charcoal-selling business for increased sales and income. With increased income, she will be able to pay for quality education for her children.

She is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add stock to her charcoal-selling business for increased sales and income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old, married and a mother of one child who is attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She works as a casual laborer, farms kale, and also operates a cereals shop. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy cereals, e.g., maize, beans and peas, to add stock to her cereals shop for increased income and to meet customers' demands. This will also enable her pay for her child’s tuition fee.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to meet customers' demands and for increased income to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Fazy

texts.en: Fazy is 21 years old, single and a freshman who resides in the Battambang Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree with a finance and banking major at a university in the province. His parents run a stall at home providing a motorcycle washing service and they also earn additional income from selling an herbal remedy. Fazy is now requesting a loan because he is short of money to pay his university fees from the second semester of his first year through his fourth year. This loan will help Fazy have enough money to earn a bachelor’s degree and to provide him with important skills for his future job. In the future, he dreams of working in a bank with a good salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the second semester of his first year through his fourth year

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making juice

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 48 years old, married and has three children. The primary source of income in their village is through rice farming. Julita is engaged in rice and vegetable farming. She has been in the farming business for over 20 years and she experienced more challenges in improving her crop production.

Now, Julita wanted to avail loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs needed for improving her crop production. She will buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming. This will help maintain a good growth of crops and someday produce a better harvest.

She hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in the farming businesses sector.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for farming

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Inocencia is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Inocencia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Inocencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Inocencia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Inocencia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Iliya  suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Iliya  now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona farmer from Pegi Vilage. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yakubu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. This season, Yakubu has ambitious plans to harvest 85 bags of maize. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Yakubu would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields and thus his income

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 60 years old and he lives with his wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. Gagik has vocational education with the specialty of architecture. Many years he worked at the Kapan city’s combine as a locksmith and then he worked as a welder. For ten years he was also a contractual military serviceman. 

Now as he likes to say, he enjoys farming and at the local school where he works as a teacher of military education. On his farm Gagik takes care of his chickens and bee hives. He sells a lot of eggs and poultry to his regular customers and also very tasty and healing honey.  All his farm products together with his land’s goods (beans, garlic, onions and peppers) he takes to the city wholesale market for sale.  

Gagik has some savings and this loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Gagik says with his saved money, will be enough to buy a truck for his farm, on which he will take his farm goods and honey to the wholesale market.

loans.use: to buy a truck for his farm, on which he will take his farm products, honey to market

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Susana has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Parissin Group

texts.fr:
Marcel est un cultivateur âgé de 36 ans. C’est lui qui tient la daba  en main en bas de la photo. Il est client au RMCR au Mali où il vit avec  sa femme et ses trois enfants âgés de douze à cinq ans dont deux sont à l’école.
Depuis douze ans il fait la culture des arachides pour vendre en gros et détail dans les différents marchés de sa zone où il fait un bénéfice prévisionnel de 17500 F par mois. La charrette qui est derrière lui permet de transporter son fumier au champ.
Marcel se réjouit dans l’agriculture car ça lui permet d’avoir beaucoup d’arachides pour la vente.  Comme il n’a pas de fond nécessaire il a fait recours au RMCR. Son rêve est d’avoir plus d’argent pour acheter des bœufs de labour pour cultiver beaucoup d’arachides. Il espère ainsi prendre en charge toutes les dépenses de sa famille et payer aussi les frais de scolarité des enfants.
L’insuffisance de matériels pour l’agriculture et la mauvaise pluviométrie sont les défis majeurs auxquels il se heurte.
texts.en:
Marcel is a 36-year-old farmer. He is the one holding the daba (short-handled hoe) at the bottom of the photo. He is a customer of RMCR in Mali where he lives with his wife and three children. They are five to twelve years of age, and two are in school.

For the past twelve years he has been cultivating groundnuts, selling them wholesale and retail at markets in his area, where he forecasts profits of 17,500 francs a month. The cart in the rear enables him to transport manure to the field.

Marcel rejoices practicing agriculture because it enables him to have lots of groundnuts for sale. Since he doesn't have the required funds he calls upon RMCR.

His dream is to earn more money and buy draft oxen to help cultivate a lot more groundnuts. He hopes this will enable him to deal with all his family's expenses and also pay the children's school fees.

The lack of agricultural equipment and poor rainfall are the major challenges he faces.

loans.use: buy groundnut seeds for his field

loans.name: Kitheuni Winners Group

texts.en:
Kitheuni Winners is a group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA)  in 2014. The group has benefited much from HiH EA training in the management of their table banking and the enterprises of the members who are involved in small enterprises like kiosks.

The person raising her hand is Esther, a member of this group. She is 65 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined HiH EA for training to be empowered and also to learn more on enterprise growth. She bakes cakes, which she sells to neighboring markets.

She is taking her first Kiva loan to buy flour and baking powder for her enterprise, which will in return increase her income, which she will use to expand her enterprise. Esther is planning to have her own building where she will be operating her business. She is so grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy flour and baking powder for her cake selling business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Fatmata.  She is single, and has 2 children aged 14 and 9 years who are in school.. She has 5 additional dependents.  Fatmata owns a business selling ladies bags, school bags, perfumes, body cream etc..  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of shoes, school bags, ladies' bags, sandals, perfumes body cream, etc. In the future, 

Fatmata plans to reinvest and expand her business, provide quality education for her children.  The loan will help her generate more income. Her major challenge is lack of adequate capital and stock.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of shoes, school bags, ladies' bags, sandals, perfumes etc

loans.name: Nana Group

texts.en:
Traji is the featured borrower for Nana Group. She got together with the other members of her group to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and make a living at the same time.

Traji is a 51-year-old married mother of seven children. She started selling cosmetics and perfumes from her house 15 years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Traji is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and perfumes to satisfy her customers' requests.

Traji is the lady standing in the middle of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Fatima is the lady standing on the left, and Nadine is the lady standing on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is twenty-six years old and married, and she is a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She operates a general retail shop, selling household goods like cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, and salt, among other items. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy additional foodstuffs and thus add stock to her general retail shop and facilitate the acquisition of a more spacious business location. This will enable her to earn more income to meet her family's needs with ease (e.g., school fees, clothing, and food).

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy additional foodstuffs and thus add stock to her general retail shop and facilitate the acquisition of a more spacious business location.

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La socia Grimanesa se dedica al negocio de combustible,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de combustible.La socia solicita el credito para comprar combustible.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Grimanesa makes a living from a fuel business. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She already has worked in this business for many years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to grow her fuel business. She is requesting the loan to purchase fuel. 

Grimanesa is happy for the loan and promises to complete the payments of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fuel.

loans.name: Jireh Group

texts.es:
Dilcy es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica. 
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el mercado de la zona ‘Mutualista’ un lugar céntrico caracterizado por encontrarce cerca del ‘cambódromo’ con capacidad para 30mil personas y mil metros de largo, dónde se realiza; el corso de carnavales, desfiles y otras actividades culturales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Dilcy es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (situada a la derecha, viste blusa lila). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de cama, venta de sandalias, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de medicinas naturales, tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares y venta de hoja de coca, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; locro (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz). Actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo, “siempre cociné y recientemente me animé a desarrollar mi emprendimiento, actualmente cuento con clientes fieles que me compran a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de muebles para la atención a mayor cantidad de clientes. Su sueño es ser el negocio preferido por los clientes, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Dilcy solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y ser la favorita de la zona.
texts.en: Dilcy is 46 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children ages 9 and 16, and her business is selling traditional food. She's a good mother, generous, understanding, a good listener, supportive, responsible, and very hard-working. She does her work at the market in the "Mutualista" area, a central area known for its proximity to the dog race track which has a seating capacity of 30 thousand and is a thousand meters long. It's where the carnival, parades and other cultural activities take place. The climate is warm and sub-tropical with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees throughout the day. Dilcy is dark-skinned with gray eyes, and long black hair that she ties behind her head. She's of medium build and height and her native tongue is Guarani which she speaks amongst family, and she speaks spanish because of the prevailing culture and the work that she does (she's located on the right, wearing a lilac blouse). She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and with her children who are attending school. They live in a house of their own with potable water, electricity, and sewage. Her desire for self-improvement led her to form a group with people whose businesses are: selling pajamas, selling sandals, selling secondhand clothes, homeopathic medicines, vehicle upholstery, smoothies, cell phone cases and coca leaves, to apply for a loan and expand their businesses. Her business is the sale of traditional dishes such as; locro (a soup with dried meat, sliced meat, yucca and eggs), majao (ground jerky, boiled bananas and rice), rice and cheese (rice, milk, and cheese) pork belly aji (pork belly, onions, and tomatoes served with rice). It's a job that she carries out every day of the week at her stand, "I always cooked and recently I worked up the nerve to build my own establishment, which currently has loyal customers that buy every day" she says. The advantage of her business is that the selling is daily, the disadvantage is the lack of furniture with which she could serve more customers. Her dream is to be the favorite business of her customers. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of tables and chairs to serve more customers. She's in the second cycle of loans with the institution in the 4 years that she's been in this line of work. These are the reasons that Dilcy is requesting a loan to purchase tables and chairs to serve more customers and be the favorite business in the area.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs to serve more customers and be an area favorite

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides use in farming

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 60 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He has a tree nursery and has been supplying and selling trees to his customers for 22 years. 

He will use the loan to buy tree seedlings of different species for planting and hopes this will enable him to have enough stock to sell to his customers. He plans to use the anticipated profits to start a retail shop business and also educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be successful in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy tree seedlings of different species for planting; he hopes this will enable him to have enough stock to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Jane has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 39 years old,  is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new equipment and furniture for her son's barber shop

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela hails from Badian, Cebu. She is 50 years old and married with two children ages 13 and 15. For 35 years, Miguela has been weaving mats using pandan leaves. She also buys and sells finished products for more profit.

Miguela wishes to expand her "buy and sell" business with the help of the loan from CEVI. She is asking for PHP 14,000 for this purpose. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy more mats to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 19-year-old single lady who has been working in selling accessories from her house since 2013, to make her living.
She is a hardworking lady who puts so much effort to expand her business and reply to customers needs.

Fatima is planning to diversify her services, thus for this reason she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start selling and renting dresses for special occasion to expand her working sector.

She hopes that in the future she can be financially capable of opening her own accessories and special occasion dresses.

loans.use: To start selling and renting dresses for special occasion to expand her working sector

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoe soles and glue for making repairs of damaged shoes for clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm, and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell, to make more income and support her family.

loans.name: Ronabel

texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old and from Badian, Cebu. She is married, with two children who are 4 and 6 years old. 

She weaves mats and raises hogs to support her family. Her business started when she had a baby. She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy more mats to sell, and also feed and piglets as a way to expand her piggery business. 

In the future, she hopes to successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy mats to sell, and also feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machines and tools so that she can open her own workshop

loans.name: Lusica

texts.en:
Lusica is 47 years old and has two children. Lusica is a married woman.

Lusica is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Lusica requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lusica has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lusica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 52 years old,  a resident of Lutete Kooki in Rakai district, and married with 10 children, all of whom have completed school. George is a focused hard working man.

He carries out a business of farming matooke (green plantain) which he started in 2004.  He works seven days a week, 12 hours a day, and he started farming with the aim of improving his daily income. His clients are people from Kampala and other towns and neighborhoods.  

However his challenge is lack of enough capital to make his garden profitable and competition.   He wants a loan of UGX 3,500,000 to buy manure for his garden.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 39 years old from Ozurgeti district. She lives with her parents, daughter and pensioner grandmother. Eter is involved in clothes selling. She purchases clothes in Ozurgeti and resells at higher price. 

Eter decided to expand her trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1700 USD to purchase a car. Once the car is purchased, Eter's father will drive it and they will bring clothes from Turkey and will resell them in Ozurgeti. The Start Up program will be a great support for them.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to transport clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, rebar, and sand to pave the corridor of her house with concrete.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La socia Marcia  se dedica al negocio de  multiservicios ,la socia tiene fotocopiadora y libreria, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener otro negocio de fotocopiadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papeles y tintas para la fotocopiadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The group member Marcia works in a multi-service business, as she has a book store and does photo copies. She's an enterprising and hardworking woman who wants to get ahead through this business. Her dream is to have another photocopy business. She's requesting a loan to purchase paper and ink for the photocopier.

loans.use: To purchase paper and ink for a photocopier.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia Justina se dedica al negocio de panaderia,la socia vende panes desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panaderia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar panes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Group member Justina works in the baking business, and sells bread from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She's been in this business for several years and it's going well for her. Her dream is to expand her baking business, and is requesting a loan to purchase bread. She's happy about the loan and pledges to make good on her payments.

loans.use: To purchase bread.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking woman from Badian, Cebu. She is 28 years old and married, with four children between 1 and 8 years old.  

Because of her children, Susan started selling fresh fish in her community. She will go to her neighbors' houses and offer them fresh fish. She has been doing this business for ten years now.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell and increase her profits. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single woman. She describes herself to be honest and she operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy animal feeds. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds to continue to improve her business

loans.name: Lilith

texts.en:
Lilith is a woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old now.

Lilith has an electronic load business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy cellphones and load (time) for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lilith has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and load (time) for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lorna has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mwihangiri Self Help Group

texts.en:
Catherine, the lady raising her hand, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She does dairy and poultry farming and sells her produce (milk and eggs) in the nearby market. She is now borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more dairy and chicken feeds to increase her animals' production of eggs and milk. With the rise in income, she will be able to pay for her children's clothing and school fees. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy and chicken feeds for increased production of milk and eggs and thus increased income to pay for her children's clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to spray plants to enhance their health so as to increase productivity.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia, tiene 27 años de edad, convive con el señor Jesús tiene cuatro hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, sus hijos estudian en la escuela y como madre quiere lo mejor para ellos. Se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus progenitores, el año 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por las lluvias que le echaron a perder sus plantaciones de cebolla y sus sembradíos. Por ello su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La señora Sonia, es una persona humilde y muy respetuosa en su comunidad donde trabaja, por lo dedicada a su trabajo agrícola, con lo cual saca a su familia adelante para así mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para comprar abono químico para la plantación de cebolla y agroquímicos de esta manera mejorara su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 27 years old and lives with her domestic partner, Jesus. She has four children, who depend of her income. Her children go to school. As a mother, she wants what is best for them. She works in agriculture, because it was the only thing she learned from her parents. In the year 2014, she experienced a reduction of her financial income because of the rains that spoiled her onion plantations and crops. Because of this, her financial stability has suffered an imbalance, directly affecting the purchase of agricultural inputs needed for the production and for her children's food. Sonia is a very humble and very respectful person in the community where she works because of her dedication to her farming work. With it she moves her family ahead so she can maintain and pay for her children's educational expenses. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy chemical fertilizers for the onion plantation, and agrochemicals in order to improve her finances and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for the onion plantation, and agrochemicals in order to improve her finances and quality of life.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in Yerevan city with his wife, his son and daughter. Gagik’s wife is a cook at a restaurant. Both his son and daughter are employed. Gagik had higher education and he was an engineer. 

But now he is busy with a very interesting craft.  He makes backgammon boards from wood. He finds his work very pleasant and also profitable. He takes orders for making backgammon boards of various styles. He can decorates them as the customer desires - with ornamentation or churches, scenes from nature or various animals.  Since it is a very good period for tourism in his city, he manages to sell his works very quickly and easily. He works in a small workshop in his house. 

This loan he needs very much as he must buy a lot of raw materials and also varnish for his craft,  which he enjoys doing so much.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and varnish for his handmade backgammon boards, which he enjoys making so much

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old.

Rina has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more lumber and additional materials for furniture.

Rina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more lumber and additional materials for furniture

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha es abuela carismática, adorable, ella es madre de 5 hijos y junto con su esposo mantuvo esta gran familia con la venta de un producto que es ajonjolí, el cual realizan en al cocina de su casa, llevan un largo tiempo vendiéndolo, son reconocidos, no son exportadores ni mayorista pero con el capital que ganan tienen para vivir y esto los hace muy feliz pues tienen lo que necesitan.

Martha ha tenido problemas, el clima, los altos costos de insumos, reparaciones en su hogar, han hecho que el poco capital que tenía para comprar surtido se haya ido es por eso que quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ajonjolí para prepararlo, empacarlo y posteriormente venderlo.
texts.en:
Martha, a charismatic and adorable grandmother, is the mother of five children whom she and her husband supported with the sale of sesame seed.  They work in the kitchen of their home and have been selling it for a long time and are well known.  They are neither exporters nor wholesale vendors, but they have enough to live on with what they earn, which makes them very happy because they have what they need.

Martha has had problems--the weather, the high cost of supplies, repairs in her home--that have reduced her capital for buying stock.  This is why she wants to request a loan to buy sesame seed to prepare, package, and then sell.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds to prepare, package, and sell

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 66 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de antojitos, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y su esposa. 

José se dedica a la elaboración ladrillos y tejas de cemento, tiene más de 15 años en este trabajo y lo aprendió cuando era ayudante en una fábrica, el trabajo está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y se transporta en bus.

Él necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar cemento y otros materiales para la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas.


Él sueña con mejorar su negocio poco a poco, aumentar la producción y obtener buenas ganancias para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old. He only studied up to Grade2. He is married and his wife works selling snack food. He has 3 children who are dependent on him and his wife.

José works making bricks and tiles. He has more than 15 years experience in this work and learned it as an assistant in a factory. His work is one km from his house and he gets there by bus.

He has great need for this loan to buy cement and other materials to make bricks and tiles. He dreams of improving his business little by little, increasing production and obtaining good profits to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials to make bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Banco De Piedra Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense de origen mazahua se integró un grupo llamado Banco de Piedra dicho nombre lo eligieron los integrantes debido a que justo en la localidad hay una gran cantera de donde extraen piedra y arena para la construcción de sus hogares. Los habitantes son personas muy amables, muy sencillas y muy trabajadoras cuya principal actividad es el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y habas, entre otros. Además de la cría y engorda de animales como borregos, conejos, becerros, pollos y pavos.
   Doña Laura es una mujer demasiado alegre, siempre encuentra la manera precisa para hacer reír a sus compañeras de grupo. Lleva un feliz matrimonio con el señor Pedro desde hace veintitrés años, él trabaja en la construcción de casas y en conjunto han formado una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales tres, se encuentran estudiando. 
   Doña Laura tiene una hija que estudia la universidad, una hija la preparatoria y uno más en la secundaria. "Mis gastos son bastantes porque debo pagar las colegiaturas de mis hijas pero echo mano de mis animales para obtener ingresos y así poder salir adelante". Actualmente, Laura se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado ovino; compra a los animales desde muy pequeños y en algunas ocasiones también nacen de las mismas borregas que tiene en casa; ha llegado a tener hasta trece al mismo tiempo. Doña Laura no gasta en alimento para sus animales pues aprovecha los extensos pastizales de su localidad. Sus principales clientes son personas de otras comunidades que valoran su actividad.
 Doña Laura esta muy agradecida con VisionFund porque su primer préstamo le permitió iniciar el negocio, recuerda que compró dos borreguitos y pastura con dos mil pesos. Actualmente su negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos ademas de comprar zapatos, ropa y pagar otros gastos.
   La meta de Doña Laura es poder iniciar con el negocio de becerros, entre risas comentó "Ojalá algún día llegue a tener un puente de animales". Con la oportunidad del préstamo comprará pastura y cinco borregos medianos para venderlos en tres meses que ha previsto que necesita el dinero.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Elvira, Rosa, Basilia y Patricia pretenden invertir en borregos y Esmeralda en trastes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco municipal, Doña Laura es quien viste el suéter rosa*
texts.en:
The group called Banco de Piedra [Stone Bench] was formed in a Mexican community of Mazahua origin. The members selected this name for their group because right in their area there is a large quarry from which stone and sand is extracted which is used to build their homes. The people are very kind, simple, and hard-working and their main occupation is growing corn, kidney beans and green beans, among other things. They also raise and fatten animals such as sheep, rabbits, calves, chickens and turkeys. 

Laura is an exceedingly happy person and always finds just the right way to make the members of her group laugh. She has been happily married to Pedro for 23 years. He builds houses and together they have created a family of four children, three of whom are students. She has one daughter who is a university student, one who is in high school and another in junior high. "My expenses are substantial because I have to pay my daughters' tuition but I rely on my animals to earn money so I can get ahead." 

Laura currently is raising and selling sheep; she buys them when they are very small and sometimes they are born to sheep she already has. She has had up to 13 sheep at one time. Laura does not have to spend money on feed for her animals because she is able to take advantage of the extensive grasslands in her area. Her main customers are people from other communities who value her work.

Laura is very grateful to VisionFund because her first loan allowed her to start up her business. She remembers that she purchased two lambs and pasture land with two thousand pesos. Today her business allows her to pay her children's educational expenses and also to buy shoes, clothing and to cover other expenses. Her goal is to be able to start a business raising calves. She laughingly commented, "I hope to have a bridge of animals one day." 

With the opportunity provided by the loan she will buy pasture land and five medium-sized sheep that she will sell in three months. The other members of the group are Elvira, Rosa, Basilia and Patricia who plan to invest in sheep. Esmeralda will invest in dishes. *The photograph was taken on the steps of the town kiosk. Laura is the one wearing a pink sweater.

loans.use: to buy grazing land and sheep.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm, in the hopes that this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 63 years old and married with nine children. 

Amparo is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Amparo requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amparo has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amparo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Alis

texts.en:
Alis is 59 years old, married, and has four kids. All his kids are married and live separately. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Alis has been working as a farmer for 36  years and has a good experience in this area. He raises seasonal fruits and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 70 AZN.

Raising and selling fruits is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People sell seasonal fruits at the local bazaar, and buyers use fruits to make delicious kinds of jam, pies, cakes, and juice. They also use dry fruit because it’s very useful for health. 

Today, Alis is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Aqroinvest  CU  in order to pay his necessary medical expenses .

loans.use: to pay his necessary medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: La Ilusión Group

texts.es:
El nombre del grupo Ilusión lo eligieron los integrantes porque ven en el crédito un camino que los lleve a triunfar en sus actividades y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ellos viven en una comunidad mazahua del Estado de México que se identifica por mantener sus tradiciones; la fiesta más grande se lleva a cabo el 2 de febrero, día de la Candelaria, donde la mayoría de las personas se reúne para celebrar. 
   Ma. Rosa es una persona seria pero muy concentrada en su trabajo. Está casada con el señor Abel, tienen una familia con cuatro hijos a la que actualmente se integraron dos nietos pequeños. De dicha pareja sólo un hijo depende económicamente de ellos y continúa estudiando la preparatoria.
   Rosa lleva 28 años criando cerdos, es una actividad que le legaron sus padres. Ella observaba que era un negocio muy rentable entonces decidió emprender el suyo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Para lo cual compra los animales desde pequeños y los cría durante cuatro meses; después vende el animal completo o por kilo. "Siempre he invertido en mi negocio y con mis ganancias he podido sacar adelante a mi familia. También mejoré mi vivienda que actualmente es de dos niveles" comentó Doña Rosa, aunque otra de sus metas es ahorrar dinero y comprar nuevos muebles. La única dificultad de Rosa es el costo del alimento para los cerdos pero el préstamo siempre le ayuda a resolver esta situación.
   Igualmente las demás integrantes invertirán en su actividad: Juana, Elena, Teresa y Agustina en criar animales; Sara M., en costuras; Sara G., en su carpintería y Gabriela, en su papelería. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio donde viven las integrantes, Rosa es quien tiene en suéter rosa*
texts.en:
The name of the group, Ilusion (Dream), was chosen by its members because they see the loan as a road that will lead them to success in their businesses and improve their standard of living. They live in a Mazahua community in the state of Mexico that's known for maintaining its traditions. The biggest festival takes place on February 2nd, the day of Candelaria, when a majority of the people get together to celebrate.

Rosa is a serious person who's focused on her work. She's married to Abel and they have a family with four children that has been joined by two young grandchildren. Only one of their children is still financially dependent on them, and said child is still attending high school.

Rosa has been raising pigs for 28 years, a job that her parents passed on to her. She noticed that it was a very profitable business and decided to launch her own business to help with family expenses and her childrens' education. To this end she purchases the animals when they're small and raises them for four months, then she sells the animals whole or by the kilogram. "I've always invested in my business and with the profits I've been able to support my family. I also upgraded my home, which now has two floors" says Rosa, although another one of her goals is to save money and buy new furniture. Rosa's only difficulty is the price of feed for the pigs, but the loan always helps her get through this situation. Likewise, the other group members will invest in their businesses: Juana, Elena, Teresa, and Agustina in animal raising; Sara M in sewing; Sara G in carpentry, and Gabriela with her stationery store.

The photograph was taken at a garden in the municipality where the group lives, Rosa is the one with the pink sweater.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the animals.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is married and has three grown up children. He is now 60 years old and still managing a farming business. He owns a hectare rice field where he plants and harvests rice with the help of laborers that he pays.  He wants to keep improving his harvest for his family's emergency needs. He wants to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP to nourish his crops with fertilizers and pesticides. This will help kill pests that affect crop growth. He hopes to achieve better crop production during harvest with his patience and hard work in the rice field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina, tiene 33 años de edad, convive con el señor Samuel tiene dos hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus padres. El año pasado sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios y también por las lluvias que le echaron a perder sus plantaciones de cebolla y la granizada que daño sus sembradíos. La señora Justina, es una persona humilde y trabaja mucho para mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos. Por los motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La señora Justina, está solicitando un crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la plantación de cebolla de esta manera podrá mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Justina is 33 years old and lives with her partner Samuel. She has two children who are dependent on their income. She makes a living from agriculture because this is the only thing that she learned from her parents. Last year she suffered a decrease in her economic income because of low prices and because of the rains that caused her to lose her onion plantations and the hailstorms that damaged her fields. Justina is a humble person who works hard  to maintain and cover her children's study costs. For the reasons mentioned, her economic stability has suffered, directly affecting her acquisition of the agricultural inputs that she needs to grow her produce in order to feed her children. 

Justina is asking for a loan which she will use to rent land on which to plant onions so that she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to rent land on which to plant onions so that she can improve her income and her quality of life

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

Myrna has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mukama Murungi Group

texts.en: Anthony - a member of Mukama Murungi group, where members guarantee each other to get a loan - lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children with ages ranging from 9 to 11 years, all of whom attend school. He ventured into buying and selling maize, beans and rice alongside other businesses, plus operating a retail-shop to get income for his family's sustainability. He desires to grow and expand his business as well as paying school fees for his children. He is seeking a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, es muy trabajador y luchador, vive con su esposa, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de barro, tiene 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias.

Rafael, se dedica a trabajar como corralero, también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que siembra es para el consumo propio de su familia, regularmente siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y con eso mantiene a su familia.

Rafael, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y para pagar los trabajadores que le ayudarán con su milpa.

Rafael, desea seguir trabajando y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su esposa y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Rafael is very hardworking and determined. He lives with his wife who makes a living hand-making clay crafts. They have six children who are grown and have their own families. 

Rafael works as a rancher and also makes a living through farming. What he sows is for his own family’s consumption, and he regularly plants 7,000 square meters of corn – and with that he supports his family. 

He is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the workers that help him with his corn crop. 

Rafael wants to continue working and to improve the living conditions of his wife and his son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the workers that help him with his cornfield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, and gravel to pave the floor of her hallway and home, thus preventing mosquitos from nesting.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
El socio Jose Fernando se dedica al negocio de notario,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:0 p.m,el sueño del socio es ampliar el trabajo de notario.El socio solicita el credito para comprar sillas para su oficina de notaria.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Group member Jose Fernando works as a notary public, his hours going from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and his dream is to expand his notary business. He's applying for a loan to purchase more chairs for his notary office.

He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for his notary office.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up to date materials and meet his customers’ demands and requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feeds, seeds, and fertilizer for use in her farm; she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 55 years old now.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Angelita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара, 33 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Самары на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, 4 козы. На 5,0 Га земли она выращивает люцерну и пшеницу. Ежемесячная прибыль Самары составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Самара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Samara is 33 years old and married. She has a secondary education, and has been rearing animals and growing crops for many years. Thanks to hard work, today Samar has two cows, 15 sheep, and four goats. She grows alfalfa and wheat on 5 hectares of land. Samara's monthly profit is about 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Samara plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Wasseniwe Group

texts.fr:
Biowé Abel est un cultivateur âgé de quarante- six ans. C’est lui qui tient la corde du bœuf devant les membres du groupe. Ill vit au Mali avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants dont 4 sont à l’école.
