Rizwana is a responsible mother of one daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of her entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Rizwana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Rizwana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Rizwana also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Rizwana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en:
Minaya is 57 years old, and a mother of 4 children.  All of her children are married and live separately.  Minaya is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She is a Jabrayili refugee.   

Minaya has been raising cattle for the past 16 years.  Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but her husband helps her raise the cattle, and she also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market.  This is the only source of income for the family.  From this business her monthly profit is 150 AZN. 

Minaya plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family and has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy additional calves.  She has plans to expand the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market.  This is her 2nd loan.  Minaya appreciates your support

loans.use: to buy additional calves.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

NWTF is relisting Melinda 's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: José Edgar

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se acompañó hace 10 años y tiene dos hijos que estudian 2° y 4° grado en la escuela, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también le ayuda en la agricultura.
José se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra una hectárea y media de maíz y frijol, tiene una vaca de la cual obtiene leche para el sustento familiar, además destaza un cerdo  cada 15 días para vender en la comunidad y en ocasiones trabaja de albañil lo cual aprendió de un amigo desde los 20 años.
Él necesita este crédito para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos y también comprará cerdos para destazar.
El sueño de José es poder mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios y logren superarse académicamente, sueña también con tener una granja de cerdos para engorde e ir mejorando la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  He has been living with his partner for ten years and they have two children who are in the 2nd and 4th grades in school.  His wife takes care of the house and children and also helps with the farming. Jose is a farmer and grows corn and beans on 1.5 hectares of land.  He gets milk for his family from his cow and he slaughters a pig every 15 days which he sells in the community. He occasionally works as a bricklayer which is a trade he learned from a friend 20 years ago. 

Jose needs this loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his crops and he also will buy pigs for slaughter.  His dream is to be able to improve his house and help his children to finish their studies and improve themselves academically. He also dreams of having a pig farm and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his crops and also to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Bruno Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.
El socio  Bruno sigue dedicándose a  ejercer la docencia en uno de los colegios de la zona, el socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como azúcar, leche, aceite entre otros.
texts.en: This is a member of the “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción” communal bank; he lives in the district of Anta, province of Anta, department of Cusco. Bruno is still teaching at one of the high schools in his area. He appreciates and values the support provided by this means and promises to make his loan payments by the established deadlines. He is a responsible and dedicated person, as this is how he gets his family ahead. He is asking for the loan to buy food for his home like sugar, milk and oil, among other items.

loans.use: to buy food for his home like sugar, milk and oil, among other items

loans.name: Rosa Otilia

texts.es:
Rosa, es madre soltera, comprarte la vivienda con su madre y dos hijos, hace aproximadamente 20 años inicio a ofrecer productos de primera necesidad en su casa, para contar con recursos económicos que le permitieran ir cubriendo las necesidades familiares, con el paso del tiempo ha adquirido experiencia y mejorado su inventario, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Para continuar con su negocio en el mercado es necesario mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, por lo que está solicitando un crédito para comprar boquitas, dulces, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, aceite, pan, etc., para ofrecer mejor variedad de productos a un precio bajo y atraer a nuevos clientes, espera adquirir al mayoreo la mercadería para que su margen de ganancias aumente.
Los sueños que Rosa tiene son mejorar las circunstancias económicas, reparar su vivienda y disminuir su nivel de endeudamiento.
texts.en: Rosa is a single mother. She shares her house with her mother and her two children. Approximately 20 years ago, she started to offer basic needs products in her house in order to have the financial resources to allow her to pay for her family needs. Over time, she has acquired experience and has improved her inventory. She assists her customers from six in the morning to seven in the evening. In order to continue with her business at the market, it is necessary to keep her customers satisfied. For this she is requesting a loan to buy snacks, sweets, basic grains, juices, sodas, oil, bread, etc., in order to offer a better variety of products at a low price and attract new customers. She hopes to get the merchandise at wholesale prices so that her margin of earnings increases. Rosa's dreams are to improve her financial situation, repair her house and diminish the level of her debt.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, basic grains, juices, sodas, oil, bread, etc., in order to offer a better variety of products at a low price.

loans.name: Melody Women Group

texts.en:
Selina (who has her hand raised) is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children, one who attends secondary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development.

Selina operates a beauty salon and also works at a nearby tea farm, picking tea as a casual labourer. She has applied for a loan through Kiva to buy more beauty products to meet her customer demands and increase her income. This will help her pay for quality education for her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to meet customer demands and increase her income to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en casa de material rústico en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, realiza esta actividad desde hace 30 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a sus equipos de destilación ya que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nazario is 47 years old and lives with his partner and their two children in a house made of rustic materials in the district of of Callayuc, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising cattle located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He makes a living by distilling brandy; he has done this for 30 years so he has a lot of experience in this business and good personal and work references in his district. He is going to use the loan to do repairs and maintenance on his distillation equipment, as it is in poor condition. With this he hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to improve his level of income and thus his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his distillation equipment, as it is in poor condition

loans.name: Rone

texts.en:
Rone would like you to know his full appreciation and thanksgiving because his previous loan has indeed helped him buy additional products for his business.  He faithfully repaid an amount of 12,000 PHP which he used to buy additional products for his inventory. 

Rone would like to continue to improve his sales and is humbly requesting for another 20,000 PHP loan which he will utilize to purchase additional water containers or gallons of water for his business.  Preferably, his customers will likely buy more items if he has more products displayed in his store. 

At some point in the future, he wants to renovate their house and be able to pay for his children's education.  If they finish studies someday, it will provide great security for better lives ahead.  He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional water containers or gallons of water for his business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 57-year-old widowed lady with 4 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  

She operates a second hand clothing sales business, and at the same time operates a farm to supplement her income. She faces challenges such as competition and high transport costs to different markets, which hinder growth of her business. 

Joyce also hopes to open a good restaurant in the near future.  She has requested a loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jenaro

texts.es:
Jenaro, de 52 años de edad, no estudio, ya que su familia no tenía los medios necesarios para que él asistiera a la escuela, está acompañado, tiene una hija la cual ya no vive con ellos porque se acompañó, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Jenaro, se dedica a la agricultura, también a la crianza de ganado desde hace más de 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, el cual  se dedicaba al mismo trabajo, ahora su hermano es quien le ayuda con los trabajos todos los días.

Jenaro, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y para comprar fertilizantes para poder seguir trabajando la agricultura.

Jenaro, sus sueños son darle un sitio donde vivir a su hija, ya que es la única que tiene.
texts.en:
Jenaro, who is 52 years old, didn’t go to school since his family didn’t have the means for him to attend. He has a wife and a daughter who doesn’t live with them anymore because she married. His wife tends to their home. 

Jenaro is a farmer and he has also raised cattle for over 20 years. He learned this work from his father who was also a farmer. Now his brother is the one who helps him with the work every day.

Jenaro needs a loan to buy a cow and to buy fertilizer to be able to keep farming. 

Jenaro’s dream is to give his daughter a place to live, since she is his only child.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to buy fertilizer to be able to keep farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel and sheet metal to build a room for the kitchen

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 40 year old married woman with 7 children living in Fort Portal Uganda and has a business of farming. She started her business with the hope of earning more income and personal development. She faces challenges of weather changes that destroy her crops. Besides that, Juliet has plans of expanding her plantation to a bigger area. Juliet has asked for a loan to buy stands for her tomatoes, weed her plantation and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy stands for her tomatoes , weed her  plantation and pay workers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles used the previous loan to buy timber for making furniture. He is a carpenter who started with a hope of earning an income. He faces hardships of low capital and high cost of timber that affect his expected returns. However, Charles is looking forward to having a better business and expanding it to new areas. Charles has asked for another loan to buy timber and paint for his furniture business.

loans.use: to buy timber and paint for his furniture business

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, atienda un molino nixtamal y una tienda en la que vende productos de la canasta básica, su negocio lo abrió hace varios años y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades en atender a sus clientes; vive en casa propia con sus esposo e hijos.
Comprará sal, azúcar, aceite, productos enlatados, jabón, detergente, etc., así cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, espera ofrecer nueva mercadería en su negocio e ir mejorando su situación económica para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Sus sueños son tener estabilidad económica para darle a su familia una vida confortable y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rosibel attends to a tortilla-batter maker and she has a store in which she sells products included in the basic family basket. She opened her business several years ago and up to the present, Rosibel has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers. She lives in her own house with her husband and children.

Rosibel will purchase salt, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, soap, detergent, etc., in order to cover customer demand. She hopes to offer new merchandise in her business and to continue improving her economic situation in order to comply with all her obligations.

Rosibel's dreams are to have economic stability and to offer her family a comfortable life and a better future.

loans.use: buy salt, sugar, cooking oil, canned products, soap, detergent, etc., to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Purificación

texts.es:
Purificación tiene 56 años de edad, estudió 9º grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres a quienes les ayuda ya que ellos están ya mayores y necesitan de su cuidado.


Purificación se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, él aprendió el oficio debido a que sus padres tuvieron muchos hijos y él era el mayor por lo tanto tuvo que trabajar desde pequeño para poder ayudarlos, el terreno donde cultiva está cerca de su casa por lo cual se va a pie.


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y frijol, de esa manera cuando saque la cosecha cancelará el préstamo y le quedará un poco para los gastos de su hogar.

E l sueño de Purificación es tener siempre las fuerzas para poder seguir trabajando la tierra.
texts.en:
Purificación is 56 years old. He went to school through the 9th grade. He is single and lives with his parents who he helps since they are older and need him to take care of them.

Purificación grows staple grains. He learned this work since his parents had many children and he was the oldest so he had to work to help them out. The land where he farms is close to his house so he goes there on foot. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for sowing corn and beans. In that way, when he harvests the crops he will pay back the loan and he will have a little left to spend on his home. 

His dream is to always have the strength to be able to keep working the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for sowing corn and beans.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед из города Худжанд. Ему 32 года. Он женат и имеет детей. Хуршед в городе живет вместе матерью, женой и детьми. Его отец в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи, он на заработках в Российской Федерации. Отцу 52 года. Маме 50 лет, и жене 24  года. Хуршед, как и любой мужчина, любящий свою семью всегда старается обеспечить им достойные жилищные условия, еду, образование и здравоохранение. Хуршед профессиональный мастер. Он берет заказы  ремонт домов, и имеет постоянную работу. Хуршед умеет все, и он начал свою деятельность 2008 году. У него много и разные электрические инструменты, для работы. Он хочет купить машину, чтобы ему было легко перевозить своих инструментов на работе и домой. Хуршеду не хватает денег, и он обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Khurshed, 32, lives with his 50-year-old mother, 24-year-old wife and children in Khujand. His father, who is 52, is currently working abroad in Russia. Khurshed, just like any man who loves his family, does his best to provide them with the best living conditions, food, education and medical services. Khurshed is a professsional home renovator with seven years of experience and a broad range of skills. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy a car for transporting his tools and he hopes that you will help him.

loans.use: to buy a car for work

loans.name: Pink Rose Group

texts.en:
Pilly, who in her early 40s, is single with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a beauty salon for six years now. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Pilly's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her salon products and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requests. She dreams of making her salon international.

Pilly will share this loan with her loan group Pink Rose, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so that she will get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so that she will get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell in the market to meet client needs and those of her family.

loans.name: María Edis

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado y es madre soltera de una niña de  cuatro años.


Desde hace 3 años, María se dedica a tejer petates y bordar mantas, decidió realizar este trabajo pues tiene que sacar adelante a su hija sin la ayuda del padre, su madre le ayuda a María en el trabajo y venden los productos por docenas.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar palma, manta por rollos, hilos, etc. para seguir elaborando petates y bordar mantas, de esa manera logrará mejorar sus ingresos para ayudarle a sus padres y a su pequeña hija.

Ella sueña con tener siempre los materiales para realizar su trabajo y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, studied up to the ninth grade and is the single mother of a four-year-old girl. For the last three years, María has made a living by knitting mats and embroidering blankets. She decided to do this work because she has to get her daughter ahead without her father's help. María's mother helps her with the work and they sell the products by the dozens.

She needs this loan to buy palm, rolls of blankets, thread, etc. to keep making mats and embroidering blankets. In this way she will be able to improve her earnings to help her parents and her small daughter. She dreams of always having the materials to do her work and thus improving her earnings.

loans.use: to buy palm, rolls of blankets, thread, etc. to keep making mats and embroidering blankets.

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.en:
Alovsat is a 53-year-old father of 4 children. All of his children are married and live separately. Alovsat is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee.

He has a spare motor parts business which he started 30 years ago. With this business, he has built a house and educated his children. However, Alovsat's challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his business and this has significantly retarded his business since he doesn’t have the variety of goods demanded by his customers. 

Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to boost his business so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: to boost his business.

loans.name: Askah

texts.en:
Askah, 49 years old, supports a family of five members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 22 years earning an income of 13,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seeds, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers to use in her farming activity.

Askah plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to expand her farming activity. Her hope is to start a stable and sustainable retail business.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers to use in her farming activity.

loans.name: Zaytuna

texts.en: Zaytuna is a talented woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. She participated in a three day training provided by IMON to startup clients. From this training, she received the necessary information for starting a business. Her idea of opening a sewing business came to her because where she lives the women are mostly housekeepers and seek income doing business at home. She felt a responsibility to help women in her area, providing a place for them to sew. She is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy sewing machines, tables and necessary items to sew. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, tables and necessary items to sew.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Laurent, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children who are still in school.  He has been selling clothes for four years now.  He works from 7:30 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Laurent's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his clothes stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment and to pay household expenses.  He will use this loan to start selling chips and to increase on the clothes stock. He dreams of becoming an intentional business man.

Laurent will share this loan with his loan group, Mt Udzungwa, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling chips and to increase on clothes stock.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn started improving her direct selling business lately through a previous loan of PHP 20,000. Because of lenders' wide and helping hands, Analyn was able to increase the profit from her enterprise, thus, allowing her family to have a little better daily living condition than usual. 

She wants to continue to improve her business so she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 which she will surely use to purchase additional direct-selling products like cosmetics and other personal product items. This can be a good opportunity for her as she tries to explore different avenues to success. By now, she just prays that your unwavering support for her won't vanish. 

With a vision in mind to have her children finish schooling, she does everything she can to support them all the way. To a woman who is determined to win, nothing is a failure, but a delayed success. 

She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional direct-selling products like cosmetics and other personal product items.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex used the previous loan to rent a tea plantation. He is a farmer, and owns rentals, the business he started with a hope of making an income. He faces challenges of price fluctuation and lack of labor force. However, Alex has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and buying more land to construct more rentals. Alex has asked for another loan to rent a tea plantation to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent a tea plantation to harvest and sell. M

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet and cassava flour plus other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en: Silvano deals in cocoa farming and selling which is supplemented by banana growing for income generation. He started farming in 1990 to raise income to support his family’s increasing demands. His family wants to buy more land and build a family house. Hence, he is requesting a loan to pay for land for construction. Silvano’s business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather and high labor costs hindering his returns.

loans.use: to use the loan to pay for land for construction.

loans.name: Tibulisio

texts.en:
Tibulisio is 40 years old and a resident of Buyamba, Kooki in Rakai district. He is married with 2 children who both attend school.
 
Tibulisoio carries out a business of produce trade which he started in 2012. In addition to that, he is a primary school teacher as well as a farmer. He works 7 days of the week and 12 hours per day. He started his business with the aim of improving on his daily income. He wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more stock of dry corn and beans to boost his business. He thinks this will help to boost his sales and profit. His clients are people from nearby towns and the neighborhood especially schools that feed his products to students. His challenges are lack of enough capital to make his garden profitable and competition.

Tibulisio is a focused and hard working man.

loans.use: to buy dry beans and corn to sell.

loans.name: Rohilahon

texts.ru:
Это жизнелюбивая и сильная женщина Рохилахон. Ей 63 года. Она в городе Турсунзаде живет вместе сыном, невесткой и внуками. Сын занимается ремонтом домов. Невестка домохозяйка, ведет домашнее хозяйство и параллельно занимается шитьем женской одежды. 
Рохилахон мастер швея. Она занимается шитьем «курпа» и «курпача». "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Рохилахон более 15 лет занимается изготовлением "курпа" и "курпача". Она просит кредит для купли швейной машинки. Рохилахон ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: This cheerful, strong woman is Rohilahon. She is 63 years old. She lives in Tursun-zoda with her son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Her son makes his living by renovating homes. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker who also makes female clothes. Rohilahon is a master tailor. She makes “kurpa” and “kurpacha”, or cotton mattresses. “Kurpa” is a square mattress used as a blanket. “Kurpacha” is a long mattress used as a sofa. Rohilahon has been making these mattresses for over 15 years. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a sewing machine, and she hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows as a transportation means.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds such as chayote, blackberry, pumpkin, parsley, celery among other products needed for cultivating.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana de 36 años es madre de dos hijos menores de edad por quienes decidió iniciar su propio negocio; consideró que necesitaba compartir más tiempo con sus hijos y trabajar desde su casa sería lo mejor.  Encontró la oportunidad de comercializar en el municipio de Tubará a sus familiares, amigos y referidos, ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar.  Ha logrado mantenerse con una amplia clientela que en temporadas como día de madres, amor y amistad, navidad o en ocasiones especiales como cumpleaños, quinceañeros o bodas, no dudan en llamarla y solicitarle detalles, además les ofrece comodidad de pago. Actualmente lleva seis años ejerciendo esta actividad y continúa muy  optimista y entusiasta, la demanda por parte de sus clientes cada vez es mayor por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para invertir en pedidos de ropa, calzado y accesorios, con la que asume logrará incrementar las ventas y ganar más utilidades.  Su gran desafío ha sido trabajar con un capital escaso, pero pese a esta dificultada ella espera que su negocio siga creciendo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Liliana, aged 36, is the mother of two underage children, for whom she decided to start her own business. She thought that she needed to spend more time with her children and that working from home would be the best option. 

She found the opportunity to sell clothing, shoes, and household items to her friends and their referrals in the municipality of Tubará. 

She has managed to keep a large customer base. In special occasions—such as Mother's Day, Valentine's Day, Christmas, birthdays or weddings—her customers don't hesitate to contact her and ask for information on her products. In addition, she gives them easy payment terms.

She has been following this occupation for six years now, and she continues to be optimist and enthusiastic. 

Demand for her products is gradually increasing. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan—her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo—to buy clothing, shoes, and accessories. With this purchase, she hopes to increase her sales and earn a higher profit.

Her biggest challenge has been to work with a small working capital. However, in spite of this, she hopes that her business continues to grow to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Surma

texts.ru: Сурма, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о трудолюбивой, оптимистичной женщине. Сурма в качестве дохода для своей семьи, с 1993 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 4 овцы. Дополнительно у нее есть земельный надел мерою 0,56 ГА, где Сурма выращивает картофель. Благодаря упорному труду Сурмы, ее деятельность приносит около 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сурма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Сурма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Surma, 54, is married and has two children. She has a high school diploma. Her neighbors speak highly of her: they characterize her as a hardworking and optimistic woman. Since 1993 Surma has been making her living from livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has three cows and four sheep. She also owns a 0.56 ha plot of land where she grows potatoes. Thanks to her hard work, Surma makes about 14,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month, which is just enough to cover her family’s basic expenses. Hoping to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy three cows. She plans to reinvest the profits.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia, de 43 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es empleado y trabaja como vigilante en una despensa, ellos tiene tres hijos, solo estudio hasta segundo grado de edad, ella se dedica a vender tortillas en su casa, tiene dos meses que inicio con ese negocio.
 
Emilia, solicita el préstamo para comprar seis pliegos de lámina para poder construir la champa donde quiere colocar el negocio y lo restante es para comprar maíz para hacer las tortillas.

El sueño de Emilia, es poder mejorar su negocio de tortillas y poder vender otros productos para el consumo diario y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Emilia is 43 years old and married. Her husband is employed and works as a security guard at a warehouse. They have three children. She only studied up to the second grade; she makes a living by selling tortillas in her house and started this business two months ago. Emilia is asking for the loan to buy six sheets of metal to be able to build the hut where she wants to have the business. The rest is to buy corn for making the tortillas. Emilia's dream is to be able to improve her tortilla business and to sell other products for daily consumption, thus having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy six sheets of metal to be able to build the hut

loans.name: Noe Alberto

texts.es:
Noé, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a que sus padres ya no contaban con los ingresos económicos suficientes para enviarlo a la universidad; actualmente está casado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando.  

Noé, es una persona que conoce muy bien todo lo relacionado a la producción de granos básicos, esa actividad la aprendió de sus padres cuando estaba soltero, como también conoce acerca de la albañilería.
    
Noé, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes para la producción de sandía y maíz. 

El sueño de Noé, es que sus hijos tengan una estabilidad familiar, como también que cumplan sus objetivos en la educación, para el desarrollo de cada uno de ellos a futuro.
texts.en:
Noé, 35, has a high school education because his family did not have sufficient income to send him to college. He is married and has two small children aged 12 and 9 who are in school.

Noé is a person who knows everything related to the production of basic staple foods. He learned this trade from his parents when he was single. He also knows about masonry. 

Noé needs money to buy fertilizer for the production of watermelon and corn. Noé’s dream is that his children will have a stable family and fulfill their goals in education toward the development of each of them in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing watermelon and corn

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de hielo y raspadilla, realiza esta actividad desde hace 02 años por lo que es conocida en su distrito por la labor que realiza y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una carpa para su negocio, con esto ella espera brindar mayor comodidad a los clientes que compran sus productos lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is 39. She lives with her partner and a son in a house that they own in a rural area in the district of Oyotún. This is a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and farming animals in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the north coast of Perú.
She's been selling ice and snow cones for two years, she is very popular in her district for her work and she has great references, personal and professional. She is asking for this loan to buy a tent for her business, to provide her customers with a more comfortable space to buy her products which will allow her to increase her income level and, thus, improve her quality of life and her family's.

loans.use: to buy a tent for her business, to provide more comfort to the customers who buy her products.

loans.name: Nelcy Rossmeri

texts.es:
Nelcy tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 1 año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, etc, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en su negocio lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelcy is 29 years old. She is in a common-law marriage with two dependent children. She lives in her own home in the rural area of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district are engaged in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry as their main economic activities. 

She sells products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and others. She has done this work for more than a year. Her business is located in her home. She asks for a loan to purchase a larger amount of rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and more. The increased stock will be useful to have more variety for her business that will allow her to increase her sales and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, and more for her store

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, tiene como actividad económica cultivar maíz y yuca, fundo su propio negocio hace más de 15 años con capital propio, posteriormente ha ido aumentando su productividad y lo mantiene como fuente de ingresos familiar. José vive con su esposa e hijos, uno de sus hijos estudia.
En vista que pronto será la temporada de lluvias requiere de un crédito para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y cubrirá otros gastos de los trabajos agrícolas, pretende tener todo listo para iniciar la siembra cuando sea necesario y obtener cosechas más abundantes.
Aspira a tener mejores cosechas, almacenar alimento para consumo familiar y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José’s economic activity is growing maize and cassava. He began he own business over 15 years ago with his own capital. He has been increasing his productivity. His business his is family’s source of income. He lives with his wife and children. One of his children is in school.

Given that the rainy season begins soon, he will need a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and to cover the costs of agricultural day laborers. He aims to have everything ready to begin planting when necessary to have a more abundant harvest. He aims to have better crops, store food for his family’s consumption, and have economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, and cover the costs of planting crops

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adriana, es jefa de su hogar, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, solo él depende de ella, no tiene apoyo económico  de familiares; como una forma de cumplir con la responsabilidad de salir adelante con su hijo instalo en su vivienda una tienda de artículos varios, tiene un horario para atender a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades en administrarla.
Necesita comprar huevos, boquitas, dulces, pastas, detergentes, arroz, azúcar, y otros productos para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten, su objetivo es tener un negocio competitivo para atraer nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son ir mejorando su negocio, contar con la fidelidad de sus clientes y darle a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una vida con mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Adriana is the head of her household. She has a 10-year-old son. Only he depends on her and doesn't have economic support from family members. As a way of managing the responsibility of providing for her son, she set up a general store in her home. She has a schedule for when she attends to customers from six in the morning until six in the evening. Right now, she has no difficulty managing it.

She needs to buy eggs, snacks, sweets, pasta, detergent, rice, sugar, and other products that her customers need. Her goal is to have a competitive business to attract new customers and increase her income.

her aspirations are to improve her business, count on her customers' loyalty, and give her son the opportunity to have a life with better food, clothing, and education.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks, sweets, pasta, detergent, rice, sugar, and other products that her customers need.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy egg-laying hens and to make a coop.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Sebastián es un hombre de 45 años de edad es casado tiene una hermosa familia de ocho hijos de las cuales son  cinco hombres y tres mujeres, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada Chichicastenango.
Sebastián con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como jornalero en una carpintería de su comunidad, él tiene quince de realizar esta labor. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica.
A Sebastián le preocupa mucho el patrimonio  de su familia pues hasta este momento ellos no cuentan con terrenos suficientes para poder heredarles a sus hijos, es por eso que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo y comprar un terreno que le están ofreciendo a un buen precio.
El gran sueño de Sebastián es poder conseguir el crédito para poder realizar la compra y construirles una casa a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sebastián, 45, is married and has a beautiful family with eight children, five boys and three girls. This humble family lives in a community called Chichicastenango.

Sebastián, with the desire to earn income and provide for his family, works as a day laborer in a carpentry in his community. He has done this work for fifteen years, but to improve his income, he depends on his wife's support. She makes traditional clothes.

Sebastián thinks a lot about his family's estate and right now, they do not have sufficient land for his children to inherit. For this reason, he made the decision to request a loan to buy land that is being sold at a good price.

Sebastián's great dream is to get credit to be able to buy and build a house for his children.

loans.use: to buy land for future construction.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es soltera y tiene 40 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado y maiz, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado y limon.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank “Sayhua”. This group is located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.
Member Tomasa is 40 years old and single. She works in the food business, she makes dishes such as ceviche, based of fish and corn. She works from 8 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She has several years in the business and she is very successful. Her dream is to own a restaurant one day. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking products such as fish and lemon.
The rest of the members work selling food, farm animals, selling groceries and other animals.
This member is thankful to those who are part of this dream through this venue and she is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as fish and lemon.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 27 años en compañía de su cónyuge comercializa calzado y ropa; ella desde su actividad como empleada doméstica ayuda al impulso de ventas ofreciéndoles a sus conocidos, mientras que él todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. está disponible para ofrecer a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, jeans y calzado deportivo. Aunque sus compras las cancela de contado en almacenes del centro de la ciudad, les ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes de acuerdo a su flujo de efectivo y como su capital es escaso para cubrir la demanda ocasionada por la temporada que se aproxima, el día de las madres, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para responder a unos pedidos de calzado y ropa para dama.  Esta inversión responde oportunamente a los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y con ello genera excelentes utilidades.  Él es padre de un niño de siete años de edad a quien desea mejoras su calidad de vida, por eso trabaja muy comprometido para lograr a futuro comprar una vivienda a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 27, in the company of his spouse, sells shoes and clothing. His wife also works as a domestic servant and helps boost their income with these sales they make to their acquaintances. He works daily from 8 am to 6 pm and is available to sell jeans and sport shoes to his neighbors, friends, and relatives. He purchases these items in cash in stores downtown and offers easy payment plans to his customers. According to his cash flow, his capital is insufficient to meet the demand caused by the upcoming season, including Mother’s Day, he is applying for a Kiva loan. It is his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

He will use his loan to fulfill a few orders of shoes and clothing for women. This investment will be used for orders placed by customers, which will generate excellent profits. He is the father of a seven-year-old son, whose life Carlos wants to improve. He works and is very committed to achieve the goal of buying a house for his family in the future.

loans.use: to fill orders for women's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La socia Laureana se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, platanos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Laureana is in the business of selling fruit. She wants to get ahead in the field, and she is very hard working. Her dream is to expand her fruit selling business, so she is asking for a loan to buy apples, oranges and bananas.
She is happy about this loan and she is committed to make every payment on time.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Cabrayil

texts.en: Cabrayil is 62 years old, and married with four children, all married and living separately.  Cabrayil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Cabrayil is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started 20 years ago when he bought his first livestock. Thanks to his very hard work, he now has six cows and 50 sheep on his farm. He also grows fruit. He makes a monthly income of 120 AZN. In order to further grow his farming business, he has turned to Aqroinvest CU and requested a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy sheep for fattening. He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further increase his number of domestic animals. He's also planning to save enough money to buy his own land.

loans.use: to further grow his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ISABEL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Filomena ella es soltera y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva cafe,cacao y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members that belong to the community bank group “Santa Isabel.” This group is located in the district of Santa Ana, located in the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

Filomena is a member of this group. She is single, 35 years old, and has two children. She works in a farming business. She has land where she grows coffee, cocoa, and bananas. She works from 6 am to 5 pm. Filomena has several years of experience in this business and is doing well. Filomena’s dream is to expand her cropland. She is seeking a loan to buy seed and fertilizer. 

The other members of this group are in the businesses of selling animals, agriculture, a grocery store, and food sales. Filomena is grateful to those who are part of this dream through the Kiva platform. She agrees to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a wall that will allow her to divide her home.

loans.name: María Aguida

texts.es:
María de 60 años de edad, está casada y su esposo trabaja de agricultor, tienen cinco hijos que ya se acompañaron y viven aparte.


María ya tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas, sus padres le inculcaron este oficio desde pequeña por lo tanto ella tiene mucha experiencia para elaborar hamacas de todo tipo.

María utilizará el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como hierro, cuartones y tejas ya que ya empezó el invierno y necesita reparar su casa.

Ella sueña con reparar su vivienda y esperar lograrlo con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 5 children who are older and not longer live with them.
María has made hammocks for many years. She learned this trade from her parents when she was very young, so she has long lasting experience in making different types of hammocks.
María will use this loan to buy construction materials such as iron, timber and tiles as winter is starting and she needs to fix her home.
Her dream is to repair her home and she hopes to meet her goal using these loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as iron, timber and tiles as winter is starting and she needs to fix her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge and other products like shrimp. fish and lobster wholesale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 43 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and one daughter, her children are studying. Shabana's husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for three years. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and manages the household. Shabana's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shabana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to aid her husband in increasing his clothes business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en:
Nabih is a 27-year-old single man who started  working in the construction field eleven years ago. He left school at an early age to work in this domain in order to cover his needs and expenses. Nabih is a hard worker and ambitious man. After he gained experience, he decided to start working on his own. Thus he is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua to buy a necessary toolkit which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better service.

Nabih hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to start his own business and buy a necessary toolkit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Phoeun is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. He is 54 years old and he lives in a wooden pile house with his wife (who is also a weaver) and his son, who is still studying. His three other children are already working and/or married. His family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2013 Phoeun decided to follow his wife and was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women. Phoeun makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for the  family's expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the fields, and to develop his wife's business. Thanks to the loan he will pay for the preparation of the loom and buy silk and have it dyed. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful, traditional, hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Modesto Arnulfo

texts.es:
Modesto de 67 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos, actualmente está casado y tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos dependen de él.

Modesto se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 38 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, también trabaja cuidando ganado desde hace muchos años.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar 2 terneras y así aumentar su ganado.


Su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Modesto is 67 years old and wasn't able to go to school since his parents didn't have the money. He is currently married and has four children, but only two of them depend on him. Modesto has made a living in agriculture for 38 years, a business he learned from this father. He has also worked raising cattle for many years. He is asking for this loan to buy two calves and thus increase his herd of cattle. His dream is to improve his living conditions and to keep working to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy two calves and thus increase his herd of cattle.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María, se encuentra casada, es madre de tres hijos con edades de 18, 14 y 12 años, todos son dependientes; por la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos familiares hace aproximadamente 18 años hizo la apertura de un comedor, lo tiene instalado en un local del mercado municipal de su ciudad, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene tres empleados para realizar las actividades del negocio y atender a los clientes que frecuentan el lugar.
El financiamiento será de utilidad para poder comprar pollo, carnes, condimentos, bebidas, verduras, aceite, leña, etc., de esta manera ofrecerá un menú más variado a sus clientes y utilizara ingredientes frescos, espera seguir dando un buen servicio. 
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando, cancelar su deuda y disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en: María is married and the mother of three children aged 18, 14 and 12 years old, all of them dependent on her. Out of the need to help with the family's expenses she opened an eatery about 18 years ago. It is in a stall in the municipal market of her city. She works from Monday to Sunday. She has three employees to carry out the work of the business and take care of the clients that frequent her place. The loan will be used to buy chicken, meat, condiments, drinks, vegetables, oil, wood, etc. In this way she can offer a more varied menu for her clients and use fresh ingredients. She hopes to continue to provide good service.  Her dream is to continue working, pay off her debt and lessen the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat. condiments, drinks, vegetables, oil, wood, etc so she can offer a more varied menu to her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tubers and fruit

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice used the previous loan to buy beer, sodas, sugar and juice to sell. She is a retailer who also operates a tea room to supplement her income. She faces challenges of low capital, yet she has dependents to look after. She also dreams of having a bigger business that can enable her to plan effectively for her dependents. Alice has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise like bread, biscuits, maize flour and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like bread, biscuits, maize flour and others to sell.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, de 63 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, vive con su esposo y su hija menor, ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

María, también se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura, ella lo aprendió desde que era una niña, cuando tenía que salir a trabajar junto a sus padres.

María, solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de sandias, abono y foliares para el cultivo y cuidado de su plantación, ya que si se le da el mantenimiento adecuado será una buena producción.

El sueño de María, es poder comprar un carro, para poder salir a vender las sandias que ella produce a otras comunidades.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old, never went to school, and lives with her husband and their young daughter. She takes care of the housework while her husband works in agriculture -- but María also works in agriculture. She learned how to farm when she was a child and had to go out and work with her parents.

María is asking for the loan to buy watermelon seeds, fertilizer and leaf treatment for cultivation and caring for her crop, as it will be a good production if she gives it the proper maintenance. María's dream is to be able to buy a car in order to sell the watermelon she produces to other communities.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds, fertilizer and leaf treatment for cultivation

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 57-year-old married woman.  She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to handle her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sherazade Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, comprensiva, constante, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘Mutualista’ un lugar muy demandado por aquellos comerciantes que quieren abrir su tienda o negocio de cualquier tipo, es un mercado muy visitado por compradores de toda la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Sonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello lacio negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (a la izquierda, viste polera verde). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela, los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por pagar los gastos médicos de sus hijos menores la hicieron liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de medicinas naturales, confección de tejidos, fabricación de sombreros de sao, venta de hoja de coca, venta de ropa de segunda mano, tienda de barrio y venta de zapatos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), Actividad que realiza durante los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo bajo techo, “cocinar a baja temperatura da buenos resultados para el paladar, a nivel de sabor, perfume y textura, porque los alimentos de esa manera no pierden sus jugos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas se realiza todos los dias, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de insumos de cocina. Su sueño es ser el puesto de venta de comida más popular, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo, papa, queso, carne y otros. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para ser el puesto de venta de comida más popular.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 42-year-old woman, she lives with her partner, and she has three children, ages two, five, and fourteen. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, and she is optimistic, understanding, persevering, supportive, responsible, and very hardworking. 

She carries out her business in a market in the “Mutualista” Zone; a place very sought after by merchants who want to open a store or any type of business. It’s a market that is much visited by shoppers from the entire city. It has a warm sub-tropical climate, with a daytime temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Centigrade.

Sonia has tan skin, brown eyes, and long, straight, black hair that she wears tied back at the nape of her neck, and her height and build are medium. Her maternal language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for business.  She is on the left, wearing a green t-shirt. 
 
She shares her life with her partner, who is a chauffeur, and with her children. The oldest is studying in school and the younger ones are not yet school-age. They live in a rented home built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. It has potable water, electricity, and a sewerage system. 

Her need to pay her children’s medical expenses led her to organize a group of people with businesses such as, selling natural medicines; weaving, making straw hats; selling coca leaves; selling second hand clothing; a neighborhood store, and selling shoes, in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.   

Her business is selling traditional food such as, majadito de charque (dried beef, rice, fried egg, and fried plantain); sopa de remojado (egg soup), locotos rellenos (peppers, ground beef, and onion); arroz con queso (rice, milk, and cheese), and ají de panza (tripe, onions, and tomato, with rice). 

She works week days in her stationary, covered, sales stand. She says, “Cooking at a low temperature gives tasty results, in terms of flavor, aroma, and texture, because the foods don’t lose their juices that way”.  Her business’s advantage is that she makes sales every day, and its disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in the purchase of cooking supplies. 

Her dream is to be the most popular food stand, and she wants to expand her business through the purchase of cooking supplies, such as oil, rice, noodles, potatoes, cheese, meat, and other items.  This is the 12th loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing this work.

That is why Sonia is requesting a loan: to purchase cooking supplies in order to be the most popular food sales stand.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies in order to be the most popular food sales stand.

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en:
Shalala is a 28-year-old young IDP (Internally Displaced Person) client from the Bilasuvar region. Shalala has two kids and is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her kids a good life. In order to do that, she is working every day without rest. This activity provides an important source of income for her family, because through planting and growing fruit, they have been able to succeed and move forward. Shalala has run a local grocery store for more than seven years. In her store she sells fruits and vegetables. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Her husband and mother help her in organizing her business.

To be able to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Shalala needs to make some investments. A loan of 700 AZN will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, and will enable her to purchase more fruit to resell in her store. This will make Shalala’s store more competitive.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell in her store

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is 58 years old and married. He and his wife have raised three children. All of his children are married and live separately.  Hafiz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has managed his small farm for almost 10 years. Due to lack of capital for use in his agricultural business, he would like to access a loan amounting to 500 AZN. He will use his loan funds to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm.

He hopes that his farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that he can earn more income with which to support his  family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 59 years old, married and blessed with five children. She does a tree planting business and has been supplying and selling the tree seedlings for 18 years now.

She will be using the loan to buy more species of tree seedlings for planting and hopes this will enable her to supply more of them to her customers. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more species of tree seedlings to plant and she hopes this will enable her to supply more of them to her customers.

loans.name: Luis Diomenes

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 18 años en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante su mototaxi, también se desempeña como chofer de cosechadora de arroz, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona y caseríos aledaños, su esposa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuenta con clientela por la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo que le permita seguir brindando este servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old and lives with his domestic partner and their 18-year-old daughter.  They live in Pucará district in Jaen Province in the Cajamarca region of the Peruvian northern highlands. It has a hot climate and most of the people there work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

Luis offers transportation services to passengers in his motortaxi, and he also drives a rice harvester. His customers are people he knows from his neighborhood and the surrounding villages.  His wife sells beauty products and has customers in the neighborhood.

Luis has requested a loan so he can buy spare parts for his vehicle so he can continue to provide this transportation service, generating more income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle so he can continue to provide his transportation service.

loans.name: Santos Eduviges

texts.es:
Santos, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.
	
Santos, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de sandía, se dedica a esta labor desde hace 20 años, fue con su padre que aprendió todo lo que sabe, el dedica tiempo al cultivo de sandía todas las mañanas y por las tardes a los demás cultivos.

Santos, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, foliares y herbicidas para eliminar la plaga que le llega a sus cultivos.

Santos, sueña con tener una buena producción de sandía y que encuentre comprador para su cosecha.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old, attended school until the third grade, is married, and lives together with his wife and three children who are still in school.  Meanwhile, his wife dedicates herself to housework.

Santos makes a living through farming, specifically by growing watermelons.  He has dedicated himself to this work for 20 years.  It was with his father that he learned everything he knows.  He dedicates himself to growing watermelons every morning, and spends the afternoons with other crops.

Santos needs the loan in order to buy fertilizer, liquid plant food, and herbicide in order to eliminate the blight that has gotten his crops.  Santos dreams of having a good watermelon production and of finding a buyer for his harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, liquid plant food, and herbicide to eliminate the blight that has gotten his crops.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz  is 40 years old married woman and a mother of 7 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Gulnaaz

texts.en: Gulnaaz, 32 years old, is a married woman. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Gulnaaz’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Gulnaaz has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 41 years old. She is married and has three kids. Her husband earns a living for their family working as a laborer. The main source of income for the family is the raising of seasonal vegetables (onions, greens, etc.) by Bahar. She has been raising vegetables for nine years and has good skills in this area.
 
Greens and onions are very popular in the Azerbaijan national cuisine. They are used in cooking kebabs, levengi, qutab, doghramajh and other dishes. That’s why these vegetables are in high demand. Bahar raises and then sells them at a local bazaar.

Her income for this small business doesn’t cover life's demands. Her harvest isn’t profitable enough and she plans to raise other vegetables and fruits additionally.  The cost of living in Azerbaijan is expensive; it’s especially hard for IDP families. She applied for 1,200 AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizer and expand her business.

loans.name: Gulovsa

texts.en: Gulovsa is 58  year old,mother of 3 kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzuli refugee.  Gulovsa has been raising cattle for the past 15 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the central bazaar. Her monthly income of 1500 AZ is the only source of income for her family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into her family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its large use in everyday meals. She is applying for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be her 2nd loan with Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact in the expansion of her business

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 45-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of rentals and, at the same time, works as a contractor with contracts from the local government. He faces the challenge of competition, though he has hopes of improving his academics and getting better qualifications. Fred has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm to enable her to grow more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Her husband is a farmer. When he has free time he operates their tricycle for passenger’s transportation. Marilou is engaged in a vending business. She sells halo-halo and barbeque and it is now peak season when summer comes. 

Her stable source of income is come from her retailing business. Marilou sells grocery items in her village. She needs to find herself an extra source of income so that she will gain a bigger income for the future of her children. Therefore, Marilou is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy grocery items such as toothpaste, shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, and condiments to sell. Marilou hopes to extend the business she has now by availing herself of the loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as toothpaste, shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Tanya Geraldina

texts.es:
Tanya de 23 años de edad, está estudiando Administración de Empresas en la universidad, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tienen un hijo de cinco años y la casa donde viven en casa alquilada.

Desde hace varios años, Tanya se dedica a vender productos de revistas de varias marcas con el propósito de adquirir más ingresos y ayudarle a su pareja.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar medicinas para su hijo y la otra parte para cubrir gastos de la universidad, de esa manera logrará satisfacer sus necesidades en este momento.

Su sueño más grande es culminar su carrera y darle lo mejor a su hijo junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Tanya is 23 years old, is studying Business Administration at the university, and is in a relationship. Her partner is a stonemason. They have a five-year-old son and the house where they live is rented. For many years, Tanya has made a living by selling products from magazines of various brands in order to earn more of an income and help her partner.

She will use the loan to buy medicine for her son and the rest to pay for university expenses. In this way she will be able to meet her needs at this time. Her biggest dream is to finish her degree and to give her son and husband the best life she can.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her son and the rest to pay for university expenses

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en: Suryia is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.
